Add the tomato purée and harissa powder to the pan. Cook for 2–3 mins to deepen the flavour. Tip in the tinned tomatoes, then fill the empty tin with water and add that too. Crumble in the stock cube and bring to a simmer.
Stir in the roasted mushrooms and walnuts, along with ¼ of the tomato tin filled with water. Simmer for 15 mins, stirring occasionally, until thick and rich. Season to taste.
Cook the pasta in salted boiling water according to the packet instructions until al dente. Reserve a mug of cooking water, then drain.
Finely grate the parmesan. Tip the drained pasta into the sauce with a splash of the cooking water and the parmesan. Take off the heat and stir well to emulsify—the sauce should cling beautifully. Add more water if needed.
Divide between bowls and top with torn basil and extra parmesan, if you like.

title: Spiced Chicken Soup With Yoghurt & Flatbreads
ingredients_raw: ['Red Onion', 'Ginger', 'Garlic', 'Ras el Hanout', 'Chickpea', 'Chicken Stock', 'Cavolo Nero', 'Third of a Leftover Roast Chicken', 'Lemon', 'Fresh Dill', 'Yoghurt', 'Flatbread', 'Extra Virgin Olive Oil', 'Fine Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Red Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Ras el Hanout", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chickpea", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chicken Stock", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Cavolo Nero", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Third of a Leftover Roast Chicken", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Dill", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Yoghurt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Flatbread", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Extra Virgin Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fine Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Finely chop the red onion, ginger and garlic cloves.
Preheat a large pan over a medium-high heat. Add a shot of olive oil and tip in the diced onion. Add a pinch of salt and cook for 5-6 mins before adding the spices, garlic and ginger. Cook for 3-4 mins before adding the chickpeas (and their liquid) and chicken stock. Bring to a boil and cook for 8-10 mins until thick and reduced a little. Roughly chop the cavolo nero and add to the stew, cooking for another 10-12 mins.
Shred the chicken into bite-sized pieces and stir through the soup. Add the zest and juice of the lemon and finish with chopped dill and a generous glug of olive oil. Serve with yoghurt, a sprinkle of ras el hanout and warm flatbreads.

title: Orzo With Chicken, Za'atar & Lemon
ingredients_raw: ['Leftover Chicken Bones', 'Chicken Stock', 'Saffron', 'Red Onion', 'Red Chilli', 'Garlic', 'Orzo', 'Za’atar', 'Third of a Leftover Roast Chicken', 'Full-Fat Greek Yoghurt', 'Lemon', 'Dill', 'Parsley', 'Olive Oil', 'Fine Sea Salt']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Leftover Chicken Bones", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chicken Stock", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Saffron", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Red Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Red Chilli", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Orzo", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Za\u2019atar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Third of a Leftover Roast Chicken", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Full-Fat Greek Yoghurt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Dill", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Parsley", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Set a large saucepan over a high heat and add a shot of olive oil. Tip in the chicken bones and roast in the hot pan until browned. Add the chicken stock and if using, the saffron. Bring to a simmer, turn the heat to low and let the whole lot tick over for 40 mins. Once done, strain and keep warm.
Meanwhile, finely chop the onion, chilli and one of the garlic cloves. Preheat a large frying pan over a medium-high heat and add a generous amount of olive oil. Tip in the red onion with a pinch of salt and cook for 8-10 mins until just starting to caramelise.
Add the chopped chilli and garlic and cook for 2-3 mins before adding the orzo. Stir through the base and toast for 1-2 mins, before adding the za’atar.
Now begin adding your stock, a ladle at a time, cooking the pasta like a risotto, until tender and silky. Shred the leftover chicken and stir through the orzo.
Finely grate the remaining garlic clove into the yoghurt along with the zest and juice of the half of the lemons.
To finish the orzo, add the remaining lemon juice and zest and adjust the seasoning. Divide the cooked orzo between warm bowls. Top with the garlicky yoghurt, a little extra za’atar and some picked dill and parsley.

title: Crispy Chicken Leg Pancakes With Ginger Chilli Dressing
ingredients_raw: ['Leftover Chicken Leg', 'Coriander Seed', 'Fennel Seed', 'Five-Spice', 'Olive Oil', 'Fine Sea Salt', 'Plain Flour', 'Boiled Water', 'Honey', 'Sesame Oil', 'Salt', 'Ginger', 'Red Chilli', 'Hoisin Sauce', 'Lime', 'Cucumber', 'Spring Onion']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Leftover Chicken Leg", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Coriander Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fennel Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Five-Spice", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fine Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Plain Flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Boiled Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Honey", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Ginger", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Red Chilli", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Hoisin Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lime", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cucumber", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Spring Onion", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 170°C.
Sit the cooked chicken legs on a tray lined with parchment paper. Combine the coriander and fennel seeds in a pestle and mortar and coarsely crush. Add the five spice and stir to combine. Cover the chicken legs liberally with olive oil and coat with the spice mixture and season with fine sea salt. Slide into the oven for 35-40 mins until super crispy.
While the chicken roasts, make the pancakes. Combine the flour with 130ml of water from a boiled kettle, the honey, sesame oil and the salt. Use a fork to bring together into a shaggy dough and then knead for 5 mins until smooth. Using hot water makes this process much quicker! Rest the dough 5 mins before dividing into 12-14 little balls. Don’t sweat about them being exactly the same size at this point, it’ll be ok! Divide into pairs (6 or 7), brush a little sesame oil over each and then sandwich them together, oil sides facing each other.
Roll the little pairs out into big flat pancakes. They’ll separate when we cook them. Once they’re all rolled, reheat a frying pan over a medium heat. Cook the pancakes for 1-2 mins per side, with a lid on, until lightly browned and cooked through. Once cooked, separate the pancakes and keep them stacked in a clean tea towel. Repeat with the remaining pieces of dough.
Finely grate the chilli and ginger and mix with the hoisin and the juice of the lime. Cut the cucumber and spring onions into matchsticks.
Remove the chicken from the oven and shred with two forks. Build your pancakes and get stuck in!

title: Salmon Pasta Salad
ingredients_raw: ['Plum Tomato', 'Ditalini', 'Green Bean', 'Kalamata Olives', 'Pickled Guindilla Chilli', 'Skin-On Salmon Fillet', 'Eggs', 'Anchovy', 'Fresh Herbs', 'Kalamata Olives', 'Pickled Guindilla Chilli', 'Capers', 'Extra Virgin Olive Oil', 'Lemon', 'Neutral Oil', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Plum Tomato", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Ditalini", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Green Bean", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Kalamata Olives", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Pickled Guindilla Chilli", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Skin-On Salmon Fillet", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Eggs", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Anchovy", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Herbs", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Capers", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Extra Virgin Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Neutral Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 190°C.
Quarter the plum tomatoes and toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and roast for 30 mins until softened.
Bring a large pot of salted water to the boil. Cook the pasta according to packet instructions, adding green beans for the last 2 mins. Drain and cool completely under cold running water.
For the dressing, blitz the herbs, the olives, the chillies, capers, olive oil, and lemon juice with salt and pepper until you have a rough pesto. Adjust with more lemon or chilli brine if needed. (You can also finely chop by hand.)
Fill a saucepan full of water and place over a high heat. Once boiling, turn the heat down to medium, gently drop the eggs in and simmer for 7 mins. Transfer to an ice bath to cool down.
Season the salmon with salt. Heat a frying pan over high heat with a glug of neutral oil. Once hot, add the salmon skin-side down. Press gently on the flesh so the skin makes even contact with the pan. Cook for 5–6 mins until the skin is crisp, then flip the fillets to colour on each side for a minute or two before turning off the heat, and letting the residual heat finish cooking.
In a large bowl, toss the pasta, dressing, green beans, remaining olives, pickled chillies, and roasted tomatoes, and peel the cooled boiled eggs and set aside.
Flake the salmon into chunks and toss gently through the salad.
Serve with the halved boiled eggs and scatter over the anchovy fillets if you'd like an extra salty kick.

title: Leftover Chicken Caesar Wraps
ingredients_raw: ['Mayonnaise', 'Worcestershire Sauce', 'Dijon Mustard', 'Garlic Clove', 'Third of a Leftover Roast Chicken', 'Anchovy', 'Iceberg Lettuce', 'Avocado', 'Crouton', 'Flour Tortilla', 'Fine Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Mayonnaise", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Worcestershire Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Dijon Mustard", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Third of a Leftover Roast Chicken", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Anchovy", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Iceberg Lettuce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Avocado", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Crouton", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Flour Tortilla", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fine Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Mix the mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce and mustard in a medium mixing bowl. Finely grate in the garlic clove and roughly half of the Parmesan. Add the zest and juice of the lemon, plenty of black pepper and mix.
Roughly chop the chicken and finely chop the anchovies. Mix these through the dressing.
Remove 4-6 large leaves from the iceberg and then roughly chop half of the remaining lettuce. Mix through the dressing along with some cubed avocado and the croutons. Grate in the remaining Parmesan.
Toast the wraps and build. Lay out two sheets of greaseproof paper and lay on your large leaves of lettuce. Nestle the flour tortillas inside and load up with your Caesar salad. Wrap the lettuce and tortillas up and around the salad. Wrap with paper, slice in half and serve.

title: Spicy Chicken With Crispy Sushi Rice
ingredients_raw: ['Sushi Rice', 'Water', 'Fine Sea Salt', 'Caster Sugar', 'Rice Vinegar', 'Sesame Oil', 'Third of a Leftover Roast Chicken', 'Mayonnaise', 'Light Soy Sauce', 'Sriracha', 'Lime', 'Black Sesame Seed', 'Spring Onion', 'Cucumber']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Sushi Rice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fine Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Caster Sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Rice Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Third of a Leftover Roast Chicken", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Mayonnaise", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Light Soy Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sriracha", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lime", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Sesame Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Spring Onion", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cucumber", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Tip the sushi rice into a small mixing bowl and rinse with cold water. Repeat the process until the water runs clear. Tip into a non-stick or well seasoned frying pan (25cm) and cover with the water. Add fine sea salt, the sugar and rice vinegar. Cover with a lid and place over a medium heat.
Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and cook for 10 mins. Once 10 mins has passed, remove the lid and allow all of the residual steam to evaporate. Use a chopstick to create little holes throughout the rice and tip in a small amount of sesame oil into each. Cook the rice over a medium-low heat, undisturbed for 10-12 mins more, until the bottom layer is crispy and caramelised.
While the rice cooks, shred the chicken into bite-sized pieces and add to a bowl. Add the mayo, soy and hot sauce as well the juice and zest of half the limes. Mix well until the chicken has broken down a little and the mixture is well incorporated. Add the sesame seeds and have a taste, adjust with lime and sriracha as you like.
Dice the cucumber into 2cm pieces and finely chop the spring onions.
Divide the crispy rice between warm bowls, top with the spicy chicken, diced cucumbers and finely chopped spring onions. Cut the remaining lime in half and serve for squeezing.

title: Quick Chicken Stew With Fennel, Olives & Filo
ingredients_raw: ['Fennel', 'Onion', 'Cumin Seeds', 'Ground Turmeric', 'Garlic Clove', 'Chicken Stock', 'Drained Cooked Chickpeas', 'Third of a Leftover Roast Chicken', 'Pitted Green Olive', 'Fresh Parsley', 'Filo Pastry', 'Red Onion', 'Lemon', 'Olive Oil', 'Fine Sea Salt']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Fennel", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Cumin Seeds", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Ground Turmeric", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chicken Stock", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Drained Cooked Chickpeas", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Third of a Leftover Roast Chicken", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Pitted Green Olive", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Parsley", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Filo Pastry", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Red Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fine Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 190°C.
Roughly chop the fennel bulb and onion. Preheat a medium-sized, oven-proof frying pan over a medium heat. Add a good glug of oil and tip in the chopped veggies. Add a pinch of salt and cook for 4-5 mins until starting to soften. Add the cumin and turmeric and cook for a minute. Slice the garlic clove and tip into the pan. Cook for 2-3 mins together before adding the chicken stock and the jar of chickpeas, liquid and all. Bring to a boil and reduce by about a third.
Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and stir through the stew with the olives. Roughly chop half of the parsley (stalks and all!) and add to the stew. Have a taste and adjust the seasoning, adding a little lemon juice if you’d like.
Lay the sheets of filo out and brush with olive oil. Scrunch them into little bundles and sit on top of your stew. Slide into the oven for 18-20 mins or until the pastry is golden and crisp.
Combine the leaves from the remaining parsley in a bowl with thinly sliced red onion and the juice of the lemon. Toss with a little olive oil and salt. Serve the crispy filo stew on warm plates with a big handful of parsley salad.

title: Chicken Kyiv Pasta
ingredients_raw: ['Chicken Breast', 'Plain Flour', 'Egg', 'Panko Breadcrumbs', 'Mixed Seeds', 'Garlic Clove', 'Spaghetti', 'Chicken Stock', 'Butter', 'Fresh Parsley', 'Lemon', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Chicken Breast", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Plain Flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Egg", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Panko Breadcrumbs", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Mixed Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Spaghetti", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chicken Stock", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Butter", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Parsley", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Lay a chicken breast between two sheets of baking parchment or cling film. Bash with a rolling pin until about 3mm thick. Repeat with the second breast.
Tip the flour onto a tray and season with salt and pepper. Crack the eggs onto another tray, whisk, and season. On a third tray, mix the panko and seeds with salt and pepper.
Dip each chicken breast into the flour, then the egg, then the seeded breadcrumb mix, pressing to coat fully.
Place the chicken in your air fryer basket and drizzle with olive oil. Air-fry at 200°C for 6–8 mins per side, or until golden and cooked through. The internal temp should read 74°C.
While the chicken cooks, bash the garlic cloves with a rolling pin — no need to peel.
Place a wide, deep pan over low heat and coat the base with olive oil. Add the garlic cloves and cook gently for 10 mins, stirring occasionally.
Pour in the spaghetti and chicken stock. Simmer for 12 mins, or until the stock is absorbed and the spaghetti is cooked al dente.
Stir in the butter, lemon zest, and chopped parsley. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Plate up the garlicky pasta with your crispy chicken on top and a wedge of lemon on the side.

title: Salmon With Crispy Bagel-Seasoning New Potatoes & Pickled Onions
ingredients_raw: ['New Potato', 'Olive Oil', 'Garlic Bulb', 'Sesame Seeds', 'Poppy Seed', 'Red Onion', 'Lemon', 'Skinless Salmon Fillet', 'Fresh Herbs', 'Cream Cheese', 'Capers', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "New Potato", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Bulb", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Poppy Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Red Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Skinless Salmon Fillet", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Herbs", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cream Cheese", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Capers", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Slice the new potatoes in half and toss with two-thirds of the olive oil, salt, and pepper. Wrap the garlic bulb in foil after coating it in a little oil.
Spread the potatoes onto a low-sided baking tray (you might need two so as not to overcrowd) along with the wrapped garlic and roast for 20 mins. Remove from the oven, toss the potatoes, then sprinkle over the sesame and poppy seeds. Return to the oven for a further 15 mins until golden and crispy.
Meanwhile, finely slice the red onion and place in a small bowl with the juice of half a lemon and a pinch of salt. Scrunch with your fingers and set aside to lightly pickle. Set aside.
Place the salmon on a separate baking tray, drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and roast for 8 mins, depending on the thickness. Remove from the oven and rest for 5 mins.
Unwrap the roasted garlic and squeeze the cloves into a small bowl. Finely chop the herbs and mix with the cream cheese, lemon juice and zest, capers, garlic, salt, and pepper until smooth.
To serve, plate up the crispy potatoes with a generous dollop of herby cream cheese, flaked salmon, pickled onions, and extra herbs and lemon if you like.

title: Spring Chicken Panzanella
ingredients_raw: ['Slices Sourdough', 'Fennel Seed', 'Third of a Leftover Roast Chicken', 'Tomato', 'Courgette', 'Red Onion', 'Capers', 'Sherry Vinegar', 'Frozen Pea', 'Asparagus', 'Fresh Basil', 'Shaved Parmesan', 'Extra Virgin Olive Oil', 'Fine Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Slices Sourdough", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fennel Seed", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Third of a Leftover Roast Chicken", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Tomato", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Courgette", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Red Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Capers", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Sherry Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Frozen Pea", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Asparagus", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Basil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Shaved Parmesan", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Extra Virgin Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fine Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Cut the bread, crusts and all, into chunky cubes. Preheat a large frying pan over a medium heat and add a generous glug of olive oil. Once hot, toss in the cubed bread and toss to coat in the warm oil. Toast over a medium heat, for 4-5 mins or until the bread starts to pick up some colour. At this point, sprinkle in the fennel seeds and use a spoon to press them into the croutons. Keep toasting for 2-3 mins until fragrant. Remove from the heat and leave them in the pan to keep warm.
Shred your chicken into bite-sized pieces, cut the tomatoes & courgette into chunks and toss them all into a large mixing bowl. Thinly slice the red onions and add them to the bowl along with the capers. Season with plenty of salt, black pepper, the sherry vinegar and a glug of olive oil. Set aside for at least 10 mins to macerate.
Bring a small pan of salted water to a boil and boil the peas for 1 minute. Fish them out and add straight to the salad bowl. Cut the asparagus into diamonds, discarding the woody ends, boil for one minute and then add to the bowl.
Tear in the basil leaves, tip in the warm croutons and finish with the shaved parmesan. Toss everything together and divide between plates. Finish with a few twists of black pepper and serve.

title: Puttanesca Gnocchi Traybake
ingredients_raw: ['Tinned Tuna', 'Gnocchi', 'Tinned Cherry Tomatoes', 'Garlic Clove', 'Chilli', 'Olive Oil', 'Tomato Purée', 'Green Olive', 'Capers', 'Water', 'Basil', 'Mozzarella', 'Parmesan', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Tinned Tuna", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Gnocchi", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Tinned Cherry Tomatoes", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chilli", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Tomato Pur\u00e9e", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Green Olive", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Capers", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Basil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Mozzarella", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Parmesan", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Heat oven to 190°C. Drain the tuna and set aside.
Toss the gnocchi in half of the oil and season with salt and pepper. Pop into the oven and cook for 5-10 mins, until golden.
Get half of the cherry tomatoes into a blender and blitz until smooth, or use a stick blender.
Finely slice the garlic and chilli (deseed it if you like it less spicy!). Heat the rest of the oil in a large pan over a medium heat and add the garlic and chilli, cooking out for 2 mins. Add the tomato purée and cook for another 1-2 mins before adding the blitzed cherry tomatoes, and the remaining un-blitzed cherry tomatoes, olives, capers and water (use it to swill out the blender and tin before adding in). Season with salt and pepper and bring to a simmer for about 15 mins.
Gently mix the tuna through the sauce along with torn basil.
Pour the sauce over the gnocchi then tear over the mozzarella and grate over the parmesan. Slide back into the oven for 15-20 mins until bubbling and golden.

title: Creamy Ham & Greens Macaroni
ingredients_raw: ['Leek', 'Broccoli', 'Garlic Clove', 'Thick-Cut Ham', 'Macaroni', 'Double Cream', 'Frozen Pea', 'Parmesan', 'Olive Oil', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Leek", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Broccoli", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Thick-Cut Ham", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Macaroni", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Double Cream", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Frozen Pea", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Remove the outer layer of the leeks, then slice in half before cutting into half moons. Pop into a colander and wash thoroughly.
Cut the broccoli into small florets and finely chop the garlic.
Heat a glug of oil in a pan over a medium heat and add the leeks and broccoli with a big pinch of salt. Sweat them down until softened and then add the garlic, cooking for another 2 mins, until the broccoli is tender and the garlic is fragrant.
Get the pasta on to boil in a large pot of salted water. Reserve the pasta water and drain.
Pour in the double cream along with the peas and chopped ham, season with salt and lots of black pepper then bring it to a very gentle simmer. Cook for a couple of minutes until the peas are thawed and the cream has thickened. Transfer the pasta to the sauce directly from the water and mix well, adding another slosh of pasta water if you need to.
Serve up and grate over the Parmesan and a crack of black pepper.

title: Spanakopita Breakfast Wraps
ingredients_raw: ['Spinach', 'Onion', 'Garlic Clove', 'Fresh Dill', 'Fresh Mint', 'Lemon', 'Cottage Cheese', 'Egg', 'Feta', 'Toasted Sesame Seeds', 'Flour Tortilla', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Spinach", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Dill", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Mint", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cottage Cheese", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Egg", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Feta", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Toasted Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Flour Tortilla", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Heat your oven to 180°C fan. Blitz the cottage cheese in a blender until smooth. Crack all the eggs (but one) into a large bowl and whisk well. Fold through the blended cottage cheese and season generously with salt and pepper.
Separate the last egg – whisk the white and set aside for later. Add the yolk into the egg mixture.
Line a large baking tray with parchment paper. Pour in the egg mixture and bake for 15 mins until puffed and golden. Turn the tray around and bake for another 5 mins for even cooking. Let it cool slightly if serving straight away, or completely if prepping ahead.
While the egg’s in the oven, peel and finely dice the onions, and peel and finely chop the garlic. Finely chop the dill and mint. Zest the lemon and set aside.
Heat a splash of olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the diced onion and garlic, season with a pinch of salt, and cook for 10 mins until soft and just golden.
Place a large colander over the sink. Add the spinach in batches and pour over boiling water to wilt. Once cool enough to handle, squeeze out as much liquid as you can. Roughly chop the wilted spinach and set aside.
Add the spinach to the pan with the softened onion and garlic. Stir through the dill, mint, lemon zest and crumbled feta. Season generously – the feta can handle it!
Cut the baked egg sheet into even rectangles. Warm the tortilla wraps in a dry pan or microwave until soft. Place an egg slice in the centre of each wrap, top with the spinach-feta filling, fold in the sides, then roll up tightly like a burrito.
Heat a dry frying pan over medium heat. Place each wrap seam-side down and cook for 2–3 mins to seal. Brush the tops with the reserved egg white, sprinkle over sesame seeds, then air fry at 200°C for 5 mins until golden and crisp.
Remove any foil, wrap in damp kitchen paper and microwave for 2 mins. Finish in the air fryer at 180°C for 7–8 mins (or in the oven at 160°C for 10 mins) until piping hot.
To Meal Prep: Assemble and seal the wraps, then store in the fridge in an airtight container for up to 4 days. Reheat as above.To Freeze: Once cooled, wrap each wrap tightly in foil or cling film. Freeze for up to 2 months. Defrost overnight in the fridge before reheating.

title: One-Pan Sausage and Roasted Pepper Lasagne
ingredients_raw: ['Drained Roasted Red Pepper', 'Water', 'Onion', 'Garlic Clove', 'Fresh Rosemary', 'Sausage', 'Tinned Cherry Tomatoes', 'Fennel Seed', 'Fresh Basil', 'Full Fat Crème Fraîche', 'Fresh Lasagne Sheet', 'Mozzarella', 'Parmesan', 'Chilli Flakes', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper', 'Olive Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Drained Roasted Red Pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Rosemary", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sausage", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Tinned Cherry Tomatoes", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fennel Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Basil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Full Fat Cr\u00e8me Fra\u00eeche", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Lasagne Sheet", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Mozzare0lla", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Parmesan", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Chilli Flakes", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Heat oven to 190°C.
Blitz the drained roasted peppers with water until smooth.
Finely chop the onion, garlic and rosemary. Squeeze the sausages out of their casings into a pan set over a medium heat. Using the back of a spoon, crumble the sausage into pieces and cook until golden. Using a slotted spoon, remove the sausages and add in a glug of oil along with the onion and garlic and chilli flakes, if using. Add a pinch of salt and cook that out for 8 mins. Add the fennel seeds and cook for two more minutes.
Tip in the blitzed peppers along with the tinned tomatoes. Add the sausages back in, along with a handful of basil leaves. Season with salt and pepper, then bring to a simmer.
Blanche the fresh lasagne sheets for 1 minute in boiling water, then drain.
Nestle the lasagne sheets into the ragù, then dot with crème fraîche before tearing over the mozzarella and grating over the Parmesan. Slide into the oven and cook for 35-40 mins or until bubbling and golden.
Remove from the oven and allow to rest for 5 mins before serving.

title: Salmon With Caramelised Onion Rice & Shaved Broccoli Salad
ingredients_raw: ['Olive Oil', 'Salted Butter', 'Onion', 'Garlic Clove', 'Basmati Rice', 'Water', 'Skin-On Salmon Fillet', 'Neutral Oil', 'Broccoli', 'Extra Virgin Olive Oil', 'Lemon', 'Za’atar', 'Natural Yoghurt', 'Tahini', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Salted Butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Basmati Rice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Skin-On Salmon Fillet", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Neutral Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Broccoli", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Extra Virgin Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Za\u2019atar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Natural Yoghurt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Tahini", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Halve and finely slice the onion; finely chop the garlic.
Add the oil and butter to a large, non-stick pan and set over a medium heat. Add the onion with a pinch of salt and cook for 10–15 mins, stirring often, until soft, sticky, and golden.
Add the garlic and cook for 1–2 mins. Stir in the rice and pour over the water. Cover with a lid and cook on low heat for about 10 mins, until the rice is tender and water absorbed. Stir gently, cover, and let steam off the heat for 10 more minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare the broccoli salad. Trim the florets from the broccoli and finely slice each one (or shave with a mandoline). In a bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, yoghurt, za’atar (if using), tahini, salt and pepper. Add the broccoli and toss to coat. Taste and adjust seasoning.
Season the salmon with salt. Heat a frying pan over high heat with a glug of oil. Once hot, add the salmon skin-side down. Press down gently on the flesh so the skin makes even contact with the pan. Cook for 5–6 mins until the skin is crisp, then flip the fillets, turn off the heat, and let the residual heat finish cooking.
Serve the salmon over the caramelised onion rice with the broccoli salad and a sprinkle of extra za’atar, if using.

title: Hot Sauce Egg Salad Sandos
ingredients_raw: ['Egg', 'Fresh Chives', 'Cottage Cheese', 'Hot Sauce', 'Soft White Bread', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Egg", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Chives", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cottage Cheese", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Bring a saucepan of water to the boil. Gently lower in the eggs, reduce to a simmer, and cook for 6 minutes. Transfer to a bowl of ice water and let them cool fully before peeling.
Meanwhile, thinly slice the chives. Stir the cottage cheese and herbs into a bowl with a drizzle of olive oil. Add the peeled eggs and mash into a creamy, chunky mix. Taste and season with hot sauce and salt to your liking. Box up and place in the fridge until ready to use.
Spoon the egg salad onto a slice of bread, and sandwich together for a fluffy and spicy egg salad sandwich.

title: Salmon With Kimchi & Tahini Noodles
ingredients_raw: ['Skin-On Salmon Fillet', 'White Sesame Seed', 'Soba Noodles', 'Kimchi', 'Cucumber', 'Vegetable Oil', 'Neutral Oil', 'Kimchi', 'Kimchi Liquid', 'Rice Wine Vinegar', 'Soy Sauce', 'Tahini']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Skin-On Salmon Fillet", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "White Sesame Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Soba Noodles", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Kimchi", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Cucumber", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Vegetable Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Neutral Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Rice Wine Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Soy Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Tahini", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Mix all the dressing ingredients in a large bowl, ready for the noodles.
Cook the noodles according to packet instructions. Before draining, reserve half a mug of the cooking water. Add a few tablespoons at a time of this to the dressing to loosen it to your desired consistency.
Drain and rinse the noodles under cold water until completely cooled. Toss with the dressing.
Finely slice the cucumber into long matchsticks and set aside in a bowl with a small pinch of salt.
Season the salmon with salt. Heat a frying pan over high heat with a glug of oil. Once hot, add the salmon skin-side down. Press gently on the flesh so the skin makes even contact with the pan. Cook for 5–6 mins until the skin is crisp, then flip the fillets to colour on each side for a minute or two before turning off the heat, and letting the residual heat finish cooking.
Divide the noodles between bowls and top with cucumber and heaped spoonfuls of kimchi.
Flake the salmon over the top and finish with a sprinkle of sesame seeds.

title: Super Nutty Salad
ingredients_raw: ['Mixed Nuts & Seeds', 'Quinoa', 'Broccoli', 'Frozen Shelled Edamame', 'Fresh Rocket', 'Carrot', 'Fresh Coriander', 'Fresh Ginger', 'Garlic Clove', 'Lime', 'Rice Wine Vinegar', 'Soy Sauce', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Mixed Nuts & Seeds", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Quinoa", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Broccoli", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Frozen Shelled Edamame", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Rocket", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Carrot", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Coriander", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Ginger", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lime", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Rice Wine Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Soy Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Heat your oven to 180°C.
Add the nuts and seeds to a baking tray and roast for 12 mins, or until golden and fragrant. Set aside to cool.
Make the dressing. Peel and grate the ginger and garlic into a small bowl. Whisk together with the olive oil, soy sauce, juice of 3 limes, and rice wine vinegar. Season with salt and pepper.
Rinse the quinoa and cook according to pack instructions. With 9 mins left on the timer, add the edamame to the pot. With 2 minutes left, add in the broccoli florets. Drain and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking, then leave to cool completely.
Prep the salad. Peel the carrot and cut into fine matchsticks. Finely chop the coriander.
In a large bowl, toss together the cooled quinoa mix, carrot, chopped coriander, rocket, and roasted nuts and seeds. If eating immediately, drizzle over the dressing and mix well. If meal prepping, store the dressing separately and add just before eating.

title: Chicken & Garlic Rice Traybake with Herby Slaw
ingredients_raw: ['Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh', 'Soy Sauce', 'Honey', 'Chinese 5 Spice', 'Fresh Ginger', 'Garlic Clove', 'Spring Onion', 'Basmati Rice', 'Chicken Stock', 'Sugar Snap Pea', 'Carrot', 'Lime', 'Sesame Seeds', 'Fresh Coriander']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Soy Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Honey", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Chinese 5 Spice", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Ginger", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Spring Onion", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Basmati Rice", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Chicken Stock", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sugar Snap Pea", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Carrot", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lime", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Coriander", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat the oven to fan 180°C. Bash the garlic, trim and thinly slice the ginger and spring onions. Wash the rice until the water runs clear.
Add the soy sauce, honey, 5-spice and bashed garlic into a bowl. Mix the chicken thighs through until coated.
Place an oven-proof frying pan over medium heat with a drizzle of oil (if you don’t have one you can transfer the dish into a baking tray before roasting). Once hot, add the chicken, and sear on one side (keep the chicken marinade). Transfer to a plate.
Add the spring onions whites and ¾ of the greens along with the ginger into the empty pan. Stir-fry until softened and fragrant, 1-2 mins. Tip the rice in with the chicken stock. Let it come to a boil, place a lid on and turn the heat down to low for 10 mins.
Uncover, place the chicken thighs on top, seared side up, and drizzle over the marinade. Place the lid back on, and transfer into the oven for 10 mins. Then, remove the lid and leave it in the oven for another 7-10 minutes, until the chicken is fully cooked and starting to char in places.
Meanwhile, trim and finely slice the sugar snap peas, slice the carrots into thin matchsticks, pick the coriander leaves and thinly slice the stems. Toss them all together with the sesame seeds. Right before serving, drizzle over some olive oil.
Once the chicken is cooked, remove the pan from the oven. Transfer the chicken to a board and let the rice rest for 5-10 mins before fluffing.
Once your chicken and rice are rested, slice the chicken. Share the rice in boxes or bowls. Add the chicken on top. Serve with the slaw and dress it with a wedge of lime.

title: Marinated Za'atar Beetroot, Feta & Minty Grains
ingredients_raw: ['Cooked Beetroot', 'Za’atar', 'Balsamic Vinegar', 'Olive Oil', 'Garlic Clove', 'Crème Fraîche', 'Ground Cumin', 'Feta', 'Mixed Cooked Grains', 'Drained Roasted Red Pepper', 'Fresh Mint', "Lamb's Lettuce", 'Lemon', 'Flaky Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Cooked Beetroot", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Za\u2019atar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Balsamic Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cr\u00e8me Fra\u00eeche", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Ground Cumin", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Feta", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Mixed Cooked Grains", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Drained Roasted Red Pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Mint", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lamb's Lettuce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Flaky Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Dice ¾ of the beetroot into small chunks and toss in a bowl with the za’atar, two thirds of the balsamic vinegar, a splash of olive oil and a good pinch of salt. Set aside to marinate.
Roughly chop the remaining beetroot and add to a blender with the crème fraîche, remaining balsamic, the garlic clove, cumin, and a squeeze of lemon juice. Blitz until completely smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Finely slice the roasted red peppers and set aside. Chop the mint finely, reserving a little for garnish.
Warm the grain pouches in the microwave according to the pack instructions, then tip into a large bowl. Stir through the red peppers, most of the mint, and a little lemon zest. Taste and season.
Spread a spoonful of the beetroot sauce on each plate. Top with a handful of lamb’s lettuce, a pile of the minty grains, spoonfuls of marinated beetroot, and crumbled feta. Finish with extra mint and a final drizzle of olive oil, if you fancy.

title: Hot Smoked Salmon Bowl with Miso Lemon Vinaigrette
ingredients_raw: ['Hot Smoked Salmon', 'Jersey Potato', 'Greek Yoghurt', 'Fresh Chive', 'Red Onion', 'White Miso', 'Lemon', 'White Wine Vinegar', 'Wholegrain Mustard', 'Honey', 'Cucumber', 'Baby Spinach', 'Olive Oil', 'Flaky Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Hot Smoked Salmon", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Jersey Potato", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Greek Yoghurt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Chive", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Red Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "White Miso", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "White Wine Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Wholegrain Mustard", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Honey", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cucumber", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Baby Spinach", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Flaky Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Bring a large saucepan of salted water to the boil. Meanwhile, halve any larger Jersey potatoes so they’re all roughly the same size. Once the water’s boiling, add the potatoes and cook for 10–15 mins until a knife slides in easily. Drain and set aside to cool slightly.
Peel and finely slice the red onion. Add to a small bowl, squeeze over the juice of ¼ of the lemon and add a pinch of sea salt. Massage with your hands for 30 seconds to soften and lightly pickle. Set aside.
Finely chop the chives. In a large mixing bowl, stir together the Greek yoghurt, chopped chives, half the wholegrain mustard, and a good pinch of salt and pepper.
Once the potatoes are cool enough to handle, toss them into the yoghurt mix and stir until well coated.
In a small bowl, whisk together the miso paste, remaining lemon juice, white wine vinegar, olive oil, remaining mustard, and honey. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Thinly slice the cucumber. Rinse and dry the spinach. Flake the hot smoked salmon into bite-sized chunks, removing any skin if needed.
Divide the spinach and cucumber between bowls or containers. Add a generous scoop of potato salad, then top with the flaked salmon and quick-pickled onions. Finish with a good drizzle of the miso vinaigrette.

title: Chicken & Chorizo Giant Couscous
ingredients_raw: ['Giant Couscous', 'Garlic Clove', 'Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh', 'Chorizo', 'Onion', 'Drained Roasted Red Pepper', 'Frozen Pea', 'Fresh Parsley', 'Lemon', 'Tomato Purée', 'Smoked Paprika', 'Chicken Stock', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper', 'Plain Yoghurt']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Giant Couscous", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chorizo", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Drained Roasted Red Pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Frozen Pea", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Parsley", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Tomato Pur\u00e9e", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Smoked Paprika", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Chicken Stock", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Plain Yoghurt", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Rub the chicken thighs with olive oil, ½ the smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Heat a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Once hot, sear the chicken for 8–10 mins, turning halfway, until golden and cooked through. Remove from the pan, cover, and let rest.
Meanwhile, peel and finely chop the garlic and onion. Dice the chorizo and finely chop the parsley stalks (reserve the leaves). Add a splash of oil to a large sauté pan over medium heat. Cook the onion, garlic, chorizo, parsley stalks, and remaining paprika for 5 mins until softened and fragrant. Stir in the tomato purée and cook for another 1–2 mins to thicken.
Slice the roasted red peppers and add them to the pan. Tip in the giant couscous and pour over the chicken stock. Bring to the boil, then reduce to a simmer. Cook for 10–12 mins, stirring occasionally, until the couscous is just tender. Stir in the peas and cook for 2 more mins.
Finely chop the parsley leaves and stir through with a big squeeze of lemon juice. Taste and adjust the seasoning. Slice the rested chicken and lay it over the couscous. Serve with extra parsley, lemon wedges, and a dollop of yoghurt if you like.

title: Everything-Seasoned Salmon with Spiced Cauliflower & Bulgur
ingredients_raw: ['Water', 'Olive Oil', 'Tomato Purée', 'Pomegranate Molasses', 'Bulgur Wheat', 'Lemon', 'Poppy Seed', 'White Sesame Seed', 'Black Sesame Seed', 'Garlic Powder', 'Onion Powder', 'Boneless Skin-On Salmon Fillet', 'Salt', 'Cauliflower', 'Red Onion', 'Garlic Clove', 'Ground Turmeric', 'Ground Coriander', 'Olive Oil', 'Lemon', 'Olive Oil', 'Balsamic Vinegar', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Tomato Pur\u00e9e", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Pomegranate Molasses", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Bulgur Wheat", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Poppy Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "White Sesame Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Sesame Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Onion Powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Boneless Skin-On Salmon Fillet", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cauliflower", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Red Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Ground Turmeric", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Ground Coriander", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Balsamic Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 160°C fan.
Make the bulgur base: Pour water and olive oil into a saucepan. Stir in the tomato purée and pomegranate molasses. Season with salt and bring to the boil. Once boiling, stir in bulgur wheat. Return to the boil, cover, and turn the heat to low. Simmer for 10 mins until the water is absorbed. Fluff with a fork, then stir through the juice of the lemon. Taste and season again if needed.
In a bowl, mix the poppy seeds, white sesame seeds, black sesame seeds, garlic powder, onion powder, and a pinch of salt.
Pat the salmon fillets dry with kitchen paper. Press the flesh side only into the seasoning mix to coat evenly. Set aside.
Cut the cauliflower into rough florets. Peel the red onions and cut into chunky wedges. Tip the cauliflower and onion into a large roasting tray with unpeeled garlic cloves. Sprinkle over the turmeric, ground coriander, and season generously. Drizzle with olive oil and toss everything to coat. Roast for 20 mins.
Remove the tray from the oven. Nestle the salmon fillets in, skin-side down. Drizzle with a little olive oil and return to the oven for 10–15 mins, or until the salmon is cooked through and flaky.
Make the dressing. In a small bowl or jar, mix olive oil with balsamic vinegar to taste. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide the bulgur into containers. Top with the roasted cauliflower, onions, and garlic. Place a salmon fillet on top of each. Serve with the balsamic dressing drizzled over, or pack it separately if storing.

title: Crispy Sesame Feta, Roast Figs & Lemon Quinoa
ingredients_raw: ['Feta', 'Sesame Seeds', 'Drained Cooked Chickpeas', 'Quinoa', 'Lemon', 'Fresh Mint', 'Fig', 'Balsamic Vinegar', 'Honey', 'Chilli Flakes', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Feta", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Drained Cooked Chickpeas", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Quinoa", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Mint", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fig", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Balsamic Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Honey", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Chilli Flakes", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Bring a saucepan of salted water to the boil. Cook the quinoa according to the pack instructions. Drain well and set aside.
Halve each block of feta lengthways to make thinner slabs, then cut each piece into quarters — you should have 8 even slices. Tip the sesame seeds onto a plate and press each piece of feta into the seeds to coat one side. Set aside.
Finely chop the mint. Zest and juice the lemon. Toss the drained quinoa with chickpeas, lemon zest, and chopped mint. In a small bowl, whisk the lemon juice with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Drizzle over the quinoa and mix well.
Halve the figs and drizzle with a little olive oil and a pinch of salt. Air-fry at 180°C for 3–5 mins until soft and juicy. Remove the figs and add the sesame-coated feta. Air-fry at 200°C for 5 mins until golden and crispy.
Mix the honey with the balsamic vinegar and chilli flakes. Drizzle generously over the warm figs.
Spoon the quinoa salad onto plates or into containers. Top with crispy sesame feta and honeyed figs. Serve warm, or enjoy cold as a lunchbox.

title: Pesto Green Beans & Broccoli
ingredients_raw: ['Green Bean', 'Broccoli', 'Pesto', 'Parmesan', 'Lemon', 'Toasted Almond', 'Olive Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Green Bean", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Broccoli", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Pesto", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Parmesan", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Toasted Almond", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Bring a pot of salted water to a rolling boil. Drop in the beans and broccoli for 3-4 mins or until just tender, still with a little bite. Shock in icy cold water and then dry.
Add the pesto to a large mixing bowl and grate in the Parmesan. Add the zest and juice of the lemon and a couple of glugs of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper and mix to a loose pesto dressing.
Drop the cooked beans and broccoli into the bowl with the dressing. Scatter over the toasted almonds and toss together.
If batch cooking for the week, transfer to containers and store in the fridge until ready to eat.

title: Spiced Chicken with Chilli Tomato Salad & Zingy Tahini Dressing
ingredients_raw: ['Lemon', 'Cashew', 'Mustard Seeds', 'Ground Ginger', 'Peeled Urid Dal', 'Asafoetida', 'Curry Leaf', 'Ground Turmeric', 'Dried Red Chilli', 'Cooked Rice', 'Garlic Clove', 'Sumac', 'Lebanese 7 Spice', 'Boneless Skin-On Chicken Thigh', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper', 'Spring Onion', 'Cherry Tomatoes', 'Crispy Chilli Oil', 'Rice Vinegar', 'Salt', 'Garlic Clove', 'Lemon', 'Ground Cumin', 'Tahini', 'Salt', 'Cold Water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cashew", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Mustard Seeds", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Ground Ginger", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Peeled Urid Dal", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Asafoetida", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Curry Leaf", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Ground Turmeric", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Dried Red Chilli", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cooked Rice", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sumac", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lebanese 7 Spice", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Boneless Skin-On Chicken Thigh", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Spring Onion", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cherry Tomatoes", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Crispy Chilli Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Rice Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Tahini", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Ground Cumin", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cold Water", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Heat a splash of olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the cashews and fry until golden. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper. Lower the heat, then add the mustard seeds and fry until they begin to pop. Add the urid dal, asafoetida, ginger, curry leaves, turmeric, and dried chillies. Fry for 3–4 mins until the lentils are golden. Remove from the heat and squeeze in the juice of the lemons. Stir through the cooked rice and season well. Set aside.
In a bowl, combine the grated garlic, sumac, Lebanese 7-spice, and a drizzle of olive oil. Season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper, then add to the bowl and mix until coated. Heat a large frying pan with oil over medium-high heat. Cook the thighs for 8–10 mins, turning until deeply golden and cooked through. Rest briefly, then slice.
In a bowl, combine the chopped tomatoes with the finely sliced spring onions. Stir through the crispy chilli oil and rice vinegar. Season with salt and toss to coat. Set aside.
Add the unpeeled garlic cloves to a blender with lemon juice and cumin. Blend until smooth. Pour the purée into a fine mesh sieve set over a bowl and press to extract the liquid. Discard solids. Whisk in the tahini — it will seize and thicken. Add a splash of cold water at a time, whisking, until you reach a smooth, yoghurt-like consistency. Season with salt.
Divide the lemon rice between lunchboxes. Top with sliced chicken and spoonfuls of tomato salad. Pack the tahini dressing separately and drizzle on when serving.

title: Smoky Bacon Beans on Fried Bread
ingredients_raw: ['Red Onion', 'Apple Cider Vinegar', 'Garlic Clove', 'Bacon Lardons', 'Olive Oil', 'Bread', 'Smoked Paprika', 'Dried Bay Leaf', 'Cooked Black Beans', 'Sugar']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Red Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Apple Cider Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Bacon Lardons", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Bread", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Smoked Paprika", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Dried Bay Leaf", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cooked Black Beans", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sugar", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Thinly slice ½ the onions then toss with the vinegar, a pinch of sugar and a little salt. Set aside. Mince the garlic and finely dice the remaining onion.
Heat a frying pan over a medium heat. Add the lardons with a drizzle of olive oil and cook until golden brown and crispy. Transfer to a plate, leaving the fat in the pan. Pour the olive oil (the full quantity listed in the ingredients list) into the pan and fry the bread in batches until golden on both sides. Transfer the fried bread to serving plates.
Add the diced onion and garlic to the pan and stir-fry for 6-8 mins until soft. Stir in the smoked paprika and bay leaf, then return the lardons to the pan. Pour in the black beans with their liquid and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 4-5 mins until thickened. Season with salt and plenty of black pepper.
Spoon the beans over the fried bread and top with the pickled onions and a splash of the pickle juice.

title: Leek-y Gnocchi Traybake
ingredients_raw: ['Gnocchi', 'Tenderstem Broccoli', 'Leek', 'Garlic Clove', 'Dijon Mustard', 'Crème Fraîche', 'Vegetable Stock', 'Fennel Seed', 'Parmesan', 'Fresh Parsley', 'Olive Oil', 'Flaky Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Gnocchi", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Tenderstem Broccoli", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Leek", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Vegetable Stock", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fennel Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cr\u00e8me Fra\u00eeche", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Parmesan", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Parsley", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Flaky Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 180°C fan.
Prep the veg. Trim and discard the tough outer layer of the leeks, then cut them into 3cm chunks. Halve the Tenderstem broccoli. Peel and finely slice the garlic. Grate the Parmesan and set aside.
Make the dressing. In a small bowl, mix the crème fraîche and Dijon mustard with a good pinch of salt and pepper. Set aside.
Tip the leeks into a large roasting tray, drizzle with olive oil, scatter over the fennel seeds, and season well. Toss to coat and roast for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, pour boiling water over the gnocchi in a large bowl. Leave to sit for 1 minute, then drain well.
Add the blanched gnocchi, sliced garlic, and Tenderstem to the tray. Pour over the vegetable stock, toss everything together, then sprinkle over the grated Parmesan. Return to the oven for 15–25 minutes, or until golden and tender.
Once out of the oven, stir through the crème fraîche and mustard mix until glossy and creamy.
Pick and roughly chop the parsley, then scatter it over the tray before serving.

title: Herby Halloumi with Dilly Rice & Tzatziki
ingredients_raw: ['Long Grain Rice', 'Orzo', 'Water', 'Fresh Dill', 'Salted Butter', 'Halloumi', 'Honey', 'Nigella Seed', 'Coriander Seed', 'Urfa Chilli Flake', 'Black Pepper', 'Lemon', 'Courgette', 'Cucumber', 'Natural Yoghurt', 'Garlic Clove', 'Fresh Mint', 'Lemon', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Long Grain Rice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Orzo", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Salted Butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Halloumi", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Honey", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Nigella Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Coriander Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Urfa Chilli Flake", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Courgette", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Cucumber", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Natural Yoghurt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Mint", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Rinse the long grain rice under cold water until it runs clear. Pick and roughly chop the fronds of dill, and finely slice the stems. In a saucepan over medium heat, melt salted butter. Add orzo and toast for 3–4 mins until golden. Stir in the rice, pour over water and season with salt. Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce to low. Cook undisturbed for 12 mins. Remove from the heat and leave covered for 10 mins. Just before serving, fluff with a fork and stir through the dill fronds and stems.
In a spice grinder or pestle and mortar, grind nigella seeds, coriander seeds, Urfa chilli flakes and a pinch of black pepper to a fine powder. Stir the spice blend into honey and set aside. Halve each block of halloumi, then cut each half into 2 triangles. Heat a little olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat and fry the halloumi for 3–5 mins per side until golden. Transfer to a plate and drizzle over the spiced honey. Finish with a grating of lemon zest if you like.
Slice the courgettes into thick 3–4cm coins. Season with salt. Heat a generous amount of olive oil in the frying pan. Once hot, lay the courgettes cut-side down. Cook for 4–5 mins until well charred, then flip and cook for 2–3 mins more. Remove from the heat and let them sit in the pan for 5 mins to finish cooking through.
Make the tzatziki. Halve the cucumber lengthways and scoop out the seeds. Finely dice the flesh. Add to a bowl with yoghurt, grate in garlic, and finely chop the mint. Zest and juice the lemon into the mix, season with salt and pepper, and stir well.
Divide the rice between containers. Top with charred courgettes and halloumi. Serve with a dollop of tzatziki on the side or in a separate pot for freshness.

title: Lunch Box: Spicy Tuna Rice Bowl
ingredients_raw: ['Jasmine Rice', 'Tinned Tuna', 'Spring Onion', 'Avocado', 'Cucumber', 'Rice Vinegar', 'Mayonnaise', 'Sriracha', 'Soy Sauce', 'Sesame Oil', 'Nori', 'Shichimi Togarashi']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Jasmine Rice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Tinned Tuna", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Spring Onion", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Avocado", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cucumber", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Rice Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Mayonnaise", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sriracha", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Soy Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Nori", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Shichimi Togarashi", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Cook the rice following packet instructions.
Finely slice the spring onions. Peel and slice the avocado. Cut the nori into strips, if using. Finely slice the cucumber and add it to a bowl with the rice vinegar and a pinch of salt. Scrunch with your hands until slightly softened.
In a bowl, mix the drained tuna with the mayonnaise, sriracha, soy sauce, sesame oil and spring onions. Taste and adjust seasoning with more soy sauce or sriracha if needed.
Divide the rice between containers. Top with a big scoop of spicy tuna, pickled cucumber, avocado and nori, if using. Sprinkle with togarashi and drizzle with more sriracha, if you like.
Pop in the fridge for an easy, flavour-packed meal later. It will keep well in the fridge for 3 days.

title: Ginger Garlic Rice, Crispy Chicken & Spicy Slaw
ingredients_raw: ['Chicken Thigh', 'Flaky Sea Salt', 'Jasmine Rice', 'Chicken Stock', 'Garlic Clove', 'Fresh Ginger', 'Shallot', 'Sea Salt', 'Sesame Oil', 'Vegetable Oil', 'Red Cabbage', 'White Cabbage', 'Carrot', "Red Bird's Eye Chilli", 'Fresh Coriander', 'White Sugar', 'Rice Vinegar', 'Fish Sauce', 'Kecap Manis', 'Chilli Oil', 'Kecap Manis', 'Chilli Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Chicken Thigh", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Flaky Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Jasmine Rice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chicken Stock", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Shallot", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Vegetable Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Red Cabbage", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "White Cabbage", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Carrot", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Red Bird's Eye Chilli", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Coriander", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "White Sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Rice Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fish Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Kecap Manis", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Chilli Oil", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Debone the chicken but leave the skin on. Mince the garlic and ginger and thinly slice the shallot.
Make the rice. Heat the sesame oil and vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the shallots and fry for 3–5 mins until golden at the edges. Stir in the garlic, ginger and rice, and toast gently for 2 mins.
Pour in the chicken stock, add a pinch of salt, and bring to a boil. Cover with a lid, reduce to the lowest heat, and simmer for 18 mins. Once cooked, remove from the heat and let it steam with the lid on until ready to serve.
Pat the chicken thighs dry with kitchen paper, then season both sides with salt. Lay them skin-side down in a cold non-stick frying pan. Place over medium heat and cook for 7–9 mins until the skin is golden and crisp. Flip and cook for another 3 mins. Set aside to rest.
Make the slaw. Thinly slice the red cabbage, white cabbage, and bird’s eye chilli. Finely julienne the carrot and finely chop the coriander. In a bowl, combine all the slaw ingredients. Mix well until the sugar dissolves and the cabbage starts to soften.
Assemble. Slice the chicken into 1–2cm strips. Spoon the rice into bowls, top with the crispy chicken, and serve with a generous side of slaw. Drizzle over extra kecap manis and chilli oil to finish.

title: Greens, Eggs and Rice
ingredients_raw: ['Jasmine Rice', 'Water', 'Spinach', 'Garlic Clove', 'Salted Butter', 'Egg', 'Toasted Sesame Seeds', 'Mixed Mushroom', 'Ground Cumin', 'Ground Coriander', 'Sesame Seeds', 'Kimchi Brine', 'Honey', 'Smooth Peanut Butter', 'Rice Vinegar', 'Olive Oil', 'Flaky Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Jasmine Rice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Spinach", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Salted Butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Egg", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Toasted Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Mixed Mushroom", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Ground Cumin", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Ground Coriander", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Kimchi Brine", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Honey", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Smooth Peanut Butter", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Rice Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Flaky Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat your oven to 220°C. Tear or slice the mushrooms into roughly 1cm chunks. Spread them out on a large baking tray. Sprinkle over the cumin, coriander, and sesame seeds. Drizzle with olive oil, season generously with salt, and toss to coat. Roast for 25–30 mins, or until golden and crisp around the edges.
Rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear, then drain well. Blitz the spinach, water, garlic and butter in a blender until smooth and vibrant green. Tip the rice into a medium saucepan, pour over the spinach mixture, and bring to a boil. Cover with a tight-fitting lid, reduce the heat to the lowest setting, and cook for 12 mins. Turn off the heat and leave to steam for 10 mins. Fluff with a fork, mix through any settled spinach, and cover again for 5 mins. Season to taste.
Bring a medium saucepan of water to the boil. Lower in the eggs and boil for 7 mins. Transfer immediately to a bowl of ice water for a couple of minutes, then peel. Roll the eggs gently in toasted sesame seeds until fully coated.
Mix the dressing. In a small bowl, whisk together the kimchi brine, honey, peanut butter and vinegar. Slowly whisk in olive oil to emulsify. Season generously with salt and black pepper.
Divide the green rice between containers. Top with roasted mushrooms and a sesame egg. Serve with the kimchi peanut dressing on the side.

title: Lemon Rice Recipe
ingredients_raw: ['Lemon', 'Cashew', 'Mustard Seeds', 'Ground Ginger', 'Peeled Urid Dal', 'Asafoetida', 'Curry Leaf', 'Ground Turmeric', 'Dried Red Chilli', 'Cooked Rice', 'Vegetable Oil', 'Salt']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cashew", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Mustard Seeds", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Ground Ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Peeled Urid Dal", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Asafoetida", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Curry Leaf", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Ground Turmeric", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Dried Red Chilli", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Vegetable Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Squeeze the lemon juice into a bowl. Set aside.
Place a frying pan over a medium heat with a drizzle of oil. Once hot, add the cashews and fry until golden. Transfer to a kitchen paper-lined plate using a slotted spoon, then set aside.
Turn the heat down to low. Tip the mustard seeds into the same pan and fry until the seeds crackle, then add the remaining ingredients (except the lemon juice and rice). Fry everything for 3-4 mins until the lentils are golden.
Add the hot mixture to the lemon juice bowl and stir well. Add the cashews and allow the dish to rest for 15 mins.
Stir the cooked rice through the rested mixture. Serve warm or cold.

title: Everything Salmon
ingredients_raw: ['Poppy Seed', 'White Sesame Seed', 'Black Sesame Seed', 'Garlic Powder', 'Onion Powder', 'Salt', 'Boneless Skin-On Salmon Fillet', 'Olive Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Poppy Seed", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "White Sesame Seed", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Black Sesame Seed", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Onion Powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Boneless Skin-On Salmon Fillet", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Heat your oven to 190°C. Place a small baking tray in there to preheat.
Mix your poppy seeds, sesame seeds, garlic powder, onion powder and salt in a bowl. Give it all a mix.
Pat your salmon fillets dry, and place them on a board skin side down. Press your everything seasoning mix all over the salmon flesh (avoiding the skin).
Remove your hot baking sheet from the oven, and place a piece of baking parchment on it. Pop your salmon fillets skin side down on top, then drizzle on a little olive oil, and bake them for 7 mins.
Turn your grill up to high. Blast your salmon under the grill for 2 mins until the top has turned a little golden.
Serve your salmon with your base and dressing of choice.

title: Smoky Spicy Roasted Mushrooms
ingredients_raw: ['Mixed Mushroom', 'Ground Cumin', 'Ground Coriander', 'Sesame Seeds', 'Olive Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Mixed Mushroom", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Ground Cumin", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Ground Coriander", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 220°C.
Tear or slice the mushrooms into 1cm chunks. Sprinkle the cumin, coriander and sesame seeds on top and drizzle with olive oil. Season generously with salt and roast for 25-30 mins, until golden.
Allow the mushrooms to cool then transfer the mushrooms to a container and store in the fridge until ready to serve.

title: Lunch Box: Honey Garlic Chicken with Broccoli Rice
ingredients_raw: ['Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh', 'Garlic Powder', 'Chilli Powder', 'Plain Flour', 'Garlic Clove', 'Gochujang', 'Soy Sauce', 'Honey', 'Lime', 'Broccoli', 'Jasmine Rice', 'Spring Onion', 'Sesame Seeds', 'Olive Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Chilli Powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Plain Flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Gochujang", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Soy Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Honey", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lime", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Broccoli", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Jasmine Rice", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Spring Onion", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Heat the oven to 200°C fan. Dice the chicken into 3cm pieces. In a bowl or flat tray, mix the garlic powder, chilli powder, flour and a pinch of salt.
Toss the chicken in the mix to coat evenly, then transfer to a baking tray and drizzle with olive oil. Slide into the hot oven to roast for 10 mins.
Meanwhile, mince the garlic then add to a bowl along with the gochujang, soy sauce, honey and the juice of the limes. Mix to combine then pour over the chicken and pop it back in the oven for another 5 mins until sticky.
