Dice the broccoli into small pieces. Cook the rice following pack instructions, adding the broccoli 3 mins before the end of the cooking time. Meanwhile, thinly slice the spring onions.
Box or plate up the broccoli rice, top with the sticky chicken, and drizzle over any remaining sauce. Scatter over the spring onions and sesame seeds. It will keep well in the fridge for 3 days.

title: Lunch Box: Halloumi Grains with Green Tahini
ingredients_raw: ['Quinoa', 'Courgette', 'Halloumi', 'Olive Oil', 'Fresh Basil', 'Tahini', 'Lemon', 'Jalapeño', 'Water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Quinoa", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Courgette", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Halloumi", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Basil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Tahini", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Jalape\u00f1o", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a boil. Add the quinoa and cook following pack instructions (about 10-15 mins). Drain and set aside.
Meanwhile, cut the courgettes into irregular 4cm pieces. Break the halloumi down its natural split, then cut into chunky pieces about the same size as the courgettes.
Heat a large frying pan over a medium-high heat. Add the halloumi and cook on all sides until golden – no need for oil. Remove from the pan.
Add the olive oil to the pan, then fry the courgettes on both sides until charred. Remove and season with salt and black pepper.
For the dressing, add the basil, tahini, juice of the lemons, ½ the jalapeños and all the water to a blender and blitz until smooth. Season with salt and black pepper, then taste and adjust if needed.
Mix the quinoa with the courgettes and season with salt and black pepper. Thinly slice the remaining jalapeño.
Box or plate up the courgette quinoa and top with the halloumi and sliced jalapeño. If eating later, store the dressing separately in an airtight container. If eating now, drizzle the dressing over the top. Everything will keep well in the fridge for 3 days.

title: Baked Tuna Egg Mayo on Japanese Rice with Teriyaki Sauce
ingredients_raw: ['Cooked Japanese Rice', 'Egg', 'Tinned Tuna', 'Spring Onion', 'Brown Onion', 'Kewpie Mayonnaise', 'Sriracha', 'Light Soy Sauce', 'Black Pepper', 'Fresh Chive', 'Toasted Sesame Seeds', 'Light Soy Sauce', 'Mirin', 'Sake', 'Light Brown Sugar', 'Fresh Ginger']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Cooked Japanese Rice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Egg", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Tinned Tuna", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Spring Onion", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Brown Onion", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Kewpie Mayonnaise", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sriracha", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Light Soy Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Chive", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Toasted Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Mirin", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sake", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Light Brown Sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Ginger", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Boil the eggs. Bring a saucepan of water to a boil. Carefully lower in the eggs and cook for 6 mins. While they cook, prep a bowl of cold water. Once done, transfer the eggs to the cold water and let them sit for 5 mins. Peel and cut into quarters.
Prep the tuna mix. Thinly slice the spring onion. Finely mince the brown onion. Drain the tuna and add to a mixing bowl along with the spring onion, brown onion, Japanese mayo, sriracha, soy sauce, and black pepper. Mix gently to combine, keeping some tuna in chunks.
Fold the egg quarters into the tuna mixture gently to avoid breaking them up too much.
Spoon the cooked rice into a small-medium ovenproof dish and spread evenly. Top with the tuna egg mayo mix and smooth out.
Turn your grill to high. Place the dish on the middle shelf and cook for 10 mins, or until golden, slightly crispy and bubbling on top.
Peel and grate the ginger. Add to a small pan with the soy sauce, mirin, sake (if using), and sugar. Stir to combine and bring to a boil. Let it bubble for 1 minute, then remove from the heat.
Remove the bake from the oven. Drizzle over the teriyaki sauce. Finely chop the chives and sprinkle on top along with the toasted sesame seeds. Serve hot.

title: Braised Soy Sauce Chicken Udon Soup Noodles
ingredients_raw: ['Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh', 'Brown Onion', 'Frozen Udon Noodles', 'Light Soy Sauce', 'Mirin', 'Sake', 'Cold Water', 'Chicken Stock', 'Spring Onion', 'Lime', 'Ice Cube', 'Sesame Oil', 'Sesame Seeds', 'Fresh Ginger', 'Shichimi Togarashi', 'Vegetable Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Brown Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Light Soy Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Mirin", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sake", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cold Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Chicken Stock", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Spring Onion", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lime", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Ice Cube", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Ginger", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Shichimi Togarashi", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Vegetable Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Frozen Udon Noodles", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Sear the chicken. Heat a splash of vegetable oil in a saucepan over high heat. Add the chicken thighs and sear for 2 mins per side until golden. Remove from the pan and reduce the heat to medium.
Prep and braise. Peel and thinly slice the onion and add it to the pan. Pour in the soy sauce, mirin, sake (if using), and cold water. Stir gently and cook for 3–5 mins until the onion softens and takes on the soy colour.
Return the chicken to the pan and pour in the dashi or chicken stock. Bring to a gentle simmer over medium-high heat and cook for 10 mins. Once cooked, remove the chicken and turn the heat to low.
Make the toppings. While the chicken cooks, slice the spring onions into thin strips and submerge them in a bowl of ice water. Zest the lime and grate the ginger.
Shred and mix. Shred the chicken and combine it in a bowl with the lime zest, sesame oil, sesame seeds, grated ginger, and drained spring onions. Mix to coat.
Cook the noodles. Bring the broth back to a boil. Add the frozen udon noodles and cook according to packet instructions.
Divide the noodles between two bowls. Ladle the broth over until the noodles are submerged. Top with a generous pile of shredded chicken and garnish with a wedge of lime and a sprinkle of shichimi togarashi, if using.

title: Garlic Oil Noodles With Grilled Chicken
ingredients_raw: ['Flat Rice Noodle', 'Brown Onion', 'Spring Onion', 'Fresh Coriander', 'Fresh Thai Basil', 'Fried Shallot', 'Lime', 'Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh', 'Ground Turmeric', 'Light Soy Sauce', 'Fish Sauce', 'Oyster Sauce', 'Light Brown Sugar', 'Black Pepper', 'Vegetable Oil', 'Garlic Clove', 'Shallot', "Red Bird's Eye Chilli", 'Light Soy Sauce', 'Fish Sauce', 'Oyster Sauce', 'Soft Light Brown Sugar', 'Vegetable Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Flat Rice Noodle", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Brown Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Spring Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Coriander", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Thai Basil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fried Shallot", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Lime", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Ground Turmeric", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Light Soy Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fish Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Oyster Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Light Brown Sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Vegetable Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Shallot", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Red Bird's Eye Chilli", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Light Soy Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fish Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Oyster Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Soft Light Brown Sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Vegetable Oil", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Soak the noodles. Place the dried pho noodles in a bowl of cold water and soak for 30 mins. Set aside.
Marinate the chicken. In a bowl, mix the chicken thighs with turmeric, soy sauce, fish sauce, oyster sauce, brown sugar, and cracked black pepper. Stir until the chicken is well-coated.
Cook the chicken. Heat a griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the vegetable oil and cook the chicken for 3–4 mins on each side, pressing gently for even browning. Remove from the heat and let rest.
Prep the aromatics. While the chicken is cooking, peel and mince the garlic cloves and shallot. Slice the Thai chilli thinly.
Make the garlic oil. Heat a glug of vegetable oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the minced garlic, shallot, and sliced chilli. Gently fry for 2–3 mins until just golden. Stir in the soy sauce, fish sauce, oyster sauce, and brown sugar. Mix well to dissolve the sugar, then set aside.
Cook the noodles. Bring a saucepan of water to a boil. Cook the soaked noodles for 1 minute less than the packet instructions. Drain and rinse under cool water until warm but not cold.
Prep the toppings. Thinly slice the brown onion and spring onion. Roughly chop the coriander and Thai basil. Cut the lime into wedges.
Assemble the bowl. Add the noodles to a large bowl and spoon over the garlic oil. Slice the grilled chicken into strips and arrange on top. Garnish with brown onion, spring onion, coriander, Thai basil, and fried shallots. Serve with a lime wedge.

title: Protein Peanut Butter Cups
ingredients_raw: ['Smooth Peanut Butter', 'Vanilla Protein Powder', '70% Dark Chocolate', 'Coconut Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Smooth Peanut Butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Vanilla Protein Powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "70% Dark Chocolate", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Coconut Oil", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Make the peanut butter filling. Warm the peanut butter in the microwave for 20–30 secs until runny. Stir in the protein powder until smooth and thick.
In a heatproof bowl, melt the dark chocolate and coconut oil together until glossy — either in short microwave bursts or over a pan of simmering water.
Assemble the cups. Line a mini muffin tin or silicone mould with paper cases. Spoon 1 tsp of melted chocolate into the base of each case. Add 1–2 tsp of the peanut butter filling, then cover with another spoonful of melted chocolate.
Transfer to the fridge or freezer and chill for at least 1 hour, or until fully set.
To serve, peel from the cases and enjoy straight from the fridge or slightly softened at room temp.

title: Halloumi Gnocchi Curry Traybake
ingredients_raw: ['Gnocchi', 'Halloumi', 'Long Mixed Pepper', 'Olive Oil', 'Flaky Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper', 'Fresh Ginger', 'Garlic Clove', 'Scotch Bonnet', 'Tomato Purée', 'Curry Powder', 'Coconut Milk', 'Vegetable Stock', 'Scotch Bonnet', 'Apple Cider Vinegar', 'Sugar', 'Salt', 'Fresh Coriander', 'Plain Yoghurt']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Gnocchi", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Halloumi", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Long Mixed Pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Flaky Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Ginger", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Scotch Bonnet", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Tomato Pur\u00e9e", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Curry Powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Coconut Milk", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Vegetable Stock", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Apple Cider Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Coriander", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Plain Yoghurt", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Quick-pickle the chilli. Finely slice the Scotch bonnet and add to a small bowl with the vinegar, sugar and a good pinch of salt. Mix well and set aside to pickle while you cook.
Preheat the oven to 200°C fan.
Make the curry sauce. Chuck all the curry sauce ingredients into a blender and blitz until smooth. Pour into a saucepan and bring to the boil. Taste and season with salt and pepper.
Dice the halloumi and peppers into bite-sized chunks. Tip into a large roasting tray with a drizzle of olive oil and season well. Roast for 10 mins.
Take the tray out, add the gnocchi, then pour over the hot curry sauce. Give everything a good mix, then return to the oven for 20–25 mins, until bubbling and golden at the edges.
Serve it up. Top with dollops of yoghurt, fresh coriander and a scattering of pickled chillies.

title: Sausage Ratatouille With Almond Pesto Traybake
ingredients_raw: ['Bell Pepper', 'Courgette', 'Red Onion', 'Garlic Clove', 'Sausage', 'Tinned Chopped Tomatoes', 'Rosemary', 'Bay Leaf', 'Smoked Almond', 'Fresh Parsley', 'Lemon', 'Garlic Clove', 'Salt', 'Olive Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Bell Pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Courgette", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Red Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Sausage", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Tinned Chopped Tomatoes", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Rosemary", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Bay Leaf", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Smoked Almond", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Parsley", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Heat the oven to 180°C. Roughly chop all your vegetables and chuck them in a baking tray.
Add the sausages, rosemary, bay leaves, tinned tomatoes and whole garlic clove to the tray. Mix everything together and get it in the oven for 45 mins.
While the sausages are cooking, finely chop the almonds and parsley. Add to a bowl, grate in the zest of lemon then squeeze in the juice. Grate in the garlic, add olive oil then whisk to emulsify. Taste and season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle over a bit more fresh rosemary to serve.

title: Tzatziki
ingredients_raw: ['Cucumber', 'Natural Yoghurt', 'Garlic Clove', 'Fresh Mint', 'Lemon']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Cucumber", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Natural Yoghurt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Mint", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Halve the cucumber lengthwise and scoop out the seeds. Cut into strips and finely dice before adding to a bowl with the yoghurt. Grate in the garlic, then finely chop the mint and add that in too. Zest and juice the lemon into the yoghurt, then season with salt and pepper before giving it a good mix.
Serve with your choice of carb and protein (it's great with grilled meats, halloumi and rice dishes). If batch cooking for the week, transfer to a container and store in the fridge until ready to eat.

title: Triple Honey Mustard Dressing
ingredients_raw: ['Dijon Mustard', 'Wholegrain Mustard', 'English Mustard', 'Apple Cider Vinegar', 'Honey', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Dijon Mustard", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Wholegrain Mustard", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "English Mustard", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Apple Cider Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Honey", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions: Combine the mustards, vinegar and honey in a mixing bowl. Stir to combine before adding the olive oil and seasoning well with salt and pepper.

title: Toasted Rice Sweet and Sour Dressing
ingredients_raw: ['Jasmine Rice', 'Chilli Jam', 'Fish Sauce', 'Lime', 'Shallot', 'Fresh Coriander']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Jasmine Rice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chilli Jam", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fish Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lime", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Shallot", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Coriander", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Place a small pan over medium heat and add the jasmine rice. Dry toast for 4-6 minutes, stirring, until golden brown.
Transfer the toasted rice to a pestle and mortar and grind into a coarse powder (some texture is fine).
In a bowl, mix the chilli jam, fish sauce, and lime juice. Stir well to combine.
Add the ground toasted rice, finely sliced shallots, and chopped coriander to the dressing.
Mix everything together and let sit for 5 mins before serving.

title: Tomato Cherry Salad
ingredients_raw: ['Shallot', 'Red Wine Vinegar', 'Tomato', 'Cherry', 'Courgette', 'Dill', 'Chilli Flakes', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Shallot", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Red Wine Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Tomato", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cherry", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Courgette", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Dill", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Chilli Flakes", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Thinly slice the shallots into rounds, separating the rounds into individual rings. Tip into a bowl and add the vinegar. Set aside for 5 mins to quickly pickle.
Now it’s time to marinate the other veggies. Chop the tomatoes into random chunks and toss into a bowl. Thinly slice your courgette and add to the bowl. Pit the cherries and add to the bowl
Season well with salt and pepper. Tear in the dill and toss through olive oil, stir the shallots through the salad. Leave this to hang out for 30 mins.
Serve the salad with your favourite protein and base.

title: Seedy Crusted Feta
ingredients_raw: ['Feta', 'Mixed Seeds', 'Olive Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Feta", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Mixed Seeds", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Preheat the grill to max.
Tip the seeds out onto a plate and season with pepper. Unpack the feta and dip each side in the seeds, they will stick naturally to the cheese.
Transfer the feta to a baking tray and drizzle with olive oil. Slide under the hot grill for 3-4 mins until golden brown.
Enjoy with your choice of carb and veg. If batch cooking for the week, transfer the feta to a container and store in the fridge until ready to serve.

title: Sesame Eggs
ingredients_raw: ['Egg', 'Toasted Sesame Seeds']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Egg", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Toasted Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Meanwhile, bring a saucepan full of water to the boil. Once boiling, gently drop the eggs in and cook for 7 mins. Transfer to a bowl of ice water for a couple of minutes, before peeling them. Add the sesame onto a plate and gently roll the eggs in them until covered.
Carefully transfer the eggs to a container and store in the fridge until ready to serve.

title: Quinoa
ingredients_raw: ['Quinoa', 'Water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Quinoa", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Wash the quinoa.
Place into pan with water and a pinch of salt.
Bring to a boil, cover, turn down to low and cook for 15-20 mins until the water has been absorbed.
Remove from the heat and let steam for 5 mins. Fluff using a fork.

title: Dill Rice
ingredients_raw: ['Long Grain Rice', 'Dill', 'Salted Butter', 'Orzo', 'Water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Long Grain Rice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Dill", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salted Butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Orzo", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Wash the rice until the water runs clear. Pick and roughly chop the dill fronds. Finely slice the dill stems.
Melt the butter in a saucepan set over a medium heat. Add the orzo and cook for 3-4 mins, stirring constantly, until toasted and browned. Stir through the rice then pour in the water. Let it come to the boil then pop the lid on and turn the heat down to low. Leave it for 12 mins (don’t remove the lid), then remove the pan from the heat and set it aside for another 10 min, still covered. Before serving, stir through the dill fronds and stems.
Serve with your choice of protein and veg. If batch cooking for the week, transfer the rice to a container and store in the fridge until ready to serve.

title: Lunch Box: Sticky Honey & Miso Aubergine Rice Bowl
ingredients_raw: ['Aubergine', 'Honey', 'Miso Paste', 'Sesame Oil', 'Lemon', 'Water', 'Pomegranate Molasses', 'Jasmine Rice', 'Green Bean', 'Red Chilli', 'Parsley', 'Sesame Seeds', 'Pomegranate Seeds (optional)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Aubergine", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Honey", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Miso Paste", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Pomegranate Molasses", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Jasmine Rice", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Green Bean", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Red Chilli", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Parsley", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Pomegranate Seeds", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Heat the oven to 200°C fan.
Cut the aubergines into wedges and place them on a baking tray. In a bowl, mix the honey, miso, water, sesame oil and lemon juice, then pour over the aubergines, tossing to coat. Roast for 30-35 mins until soft and sticky. Once cooked, remove from the oven and drizzle over the pomegranate molasses.
Meanwhile, cook the rice following pack instructions. Four mins before the end of the cooking time, add the green beans. Slice the red chilli and pick the parsley leaves.
Divide the rice between bowls or meal prep containers. Top with the sticky aubergines, drizzling over any leftover marinade from the tray. Scatter with sesame seeds, red chilli and parsley. Finish with pomegranate seeds, if using. It will keep well in the fridge for 3 days.

title: Tikka Halloumi Skewers
ingredients_raw: ['Halloumi', 'Natural Yoghurt', 'Tikka Masala Paste', 'Basmati Rice', 'Courgette', 'Cucumber', 'Red Onion', 'Fresh Mint', 'Pomegranate Seeds', 'Red Chilli', 'Lime', 'Olive Oil', 'Flaky Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Halloumi", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Natural Yoghurt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Tikka Masala Paste", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Basmati Rice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Courgette", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cucumber", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Red Onion", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Mint", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Pomegranate Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Red Chilli", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lime", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Flaky Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Cut the halloumi into 2cm chunks. In a bowl, mix ¼ of the yoghurt with the tikka masala paste, a drizzle of olive oil, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Toss in the halloumi to coat, then set aside to marinate.
Slice the courgette into 3cm-thick rounds. Set aside for threading onto skewers later.
Rinse the basmati rice, then cook it in a pan of salted boiling water according to the packet instructions. Drain and fluff with a fork once cooked.
Halve the cucumber lengthways and finely chop. Peel and finely slice the red onion. Slice the red chilli. Pick the mint leaves and roughly chop.
In a bowl, toss together the cucumber, onion, chilli, mint, and pomegranate seeds. Squeeze over the juice of ½ a lime and season with salt and pepper. Cut the remaining lime half into wedges.
Thread the marinated halloumi and courgette onto skewers. Air fry at 200°C for 15 mins until golden and slightly charred, turning halfway. If using mango chutney (optional), stir it through the remaining yoghurt now and season to taste. If not, just season the yoghurt with salt and pepper.
Divide the rice between plates. Top with the herby pomegranate salad and the skewers. Serve with the lime wedges and a dollop of the seasoned yoghurt.

title: Date Bark
ingredients_raw: ['Pitted Date', 'Smooth Peanut Butter', 'Peanut', 'Dark Chocolate', 'Coconut Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Pitted Date", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Smooth Peanut Butter", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Peanut", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Dark Chocolate", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Coconut Oil", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Line a small baking sheet with parchment paper. Split dates open and press each one, sticky side down onto the sheet making sure they overlap and stick together. Cover the top with more parchment paper and press firmly until you have a homogenous rectangle of dates. Flip them over so they are sticky side up and remove the top layer of parchment.
Drizzle peanut butter over the top and spread evenly. You can pop the peanut butter in the microwave for 20 seconds to loosen, if needed.
Chop up the peanuts and sprinkle them over the top of the peanut butter.
Melt the chocolate in the microwave with the coconut oil in 30-second bursts, stirring between each go until smooth and spread over the top.
Pop in the freezer for 15-20 minutes and portion.
Store in the fridge or freezer.

title: Sumac Chicken
ingredients_raw: ['Garlic Clove', 'Sumac', 'Lebanese 7-Spice', 'Chicken Thigh', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sumac", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lebanese 7-Spice", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Chicken Thigh", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Peel and finely grate the garlic into a bowl. Add the sumac, 7-spice, chicken thighs and a drizzle of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper, then mix thoroughly. Set aside.
Add a drizzle of olive oil to a frying pan and set over a medium-high heat. Once hot, add the chicken thighs and cook for 8-10 mins until cooked through and golden brown on both sides.
Slice the chicken into strips and pair it with your favourite base.

title: Roasted Peppers
ingredients_raw: ['Romano Pepper', 'Olive Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Romano Pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Preheat your oven to 220°C.
Place the whole Romano peppers on a baking tray, drizzle over a good glug of olive oil and roast for 15 mins.
Pair your peppers up with the rest of your lunch components.

title: Nuoc Cham (Vietnamese Fish Sauce Dressing)
ingredients_raw: ['Garlic Clove', 'Fresh Ginger', "Red Bird's Eye Chilli", 'Fish Sauce', 'Rice Vinegar', 'Lime Juice', 'Sugar', 'Water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Red Bird's Eye Chilli", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fish Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Rice Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lime Juice", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Mince the garlic and ginger and finely chop the chillies.
In a small bowl, combine the minced garlic, ginger, and chopped chillies.
Add the fish sauce, rice vinegar, lime juice, sugar, and water.
Stir well until the sugar is fully dissolved.
Let sit for at least 5 mins to allow the flavours to meld.
Serve immediately or store in the fridge for up to a week.

title: Avocado & Jalapeño Crema
ingredients_raw: ['0% Fat Greek Yoghurt\u2063', 'Jalapeño', 'Avocado', 'Fresh Coriander', 'Lime', 'Salt']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Jalape\u00f1o", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Avocado", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Coriander", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lime", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Deseed and chop the jalapeños. Add the Greek yoghurt, jalapeños, avocado, half of the coriander, and lime juice to a blender.
Blend until smooth, scraping down the sides as needed.
Season with salt to taste.
Garnish with extra coriander and serve.

title: Chocolate Protein Millionaire's Shortbread
ingredients_raw: ['Peanut Butter', 'Honey', 'Coconut Oil', 'Vanilla Extract', 'Chocolate Protein Powder', 'Plain Protein Powder', 'Ground Flaxseed', 'Almond Flour', 'Cacao Nib', 'Pitted Date', '70% Dark Chocolate', 'Chocolate', 'Flaky Sea Salt']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Peanut Butter", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Honey", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Coconut Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Vanilla Extract", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Chocolate Protein Powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Plain Protein Powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Ground Flaxseed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Almond Flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cacao Nib", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Pitted Date", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "70% Dark Chocolate", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Chocolate", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Flaky Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Make the date caramel. Soak the pitted dates in hot water for 10 mins. Drain and blend into a smooth caramel paste. Set aside.
Now scoop the coconut oil into a small saucepan and heat over low heat, stirring gently until just melted.
Mix the base. In a large bowl, mix together the peanut butter, honey, melted coconut oil and vanilla until smooth. Add the chocolate and plain protein powders, then stir in the almond flour, flaxseed meal, and cacao nibs. Mix until fully combined — use your hands if needed.
Line a small loaf tin or 8x4 inch tray with greaseproof paper. Press the mixture evenly into the base of the tin to form a flat layer.
Spread the blended date caramel evenly over the base.
Melt the dark chocolate with a little extra coconut oil until glossy. Pour over the caramel layer and smooth out. If you’re feeling fancy, melt the white chocolate and pour it over the melted dark chocolate. Using a toothpick, make swirls in the chocolate to create a marbled effect. Sprinkle with flaky sea salt.
Transfer to the fridge and chill for at least 1 hour (or overnight) until firm. Slice into 6 bars and enjoy.

title: Spring Onion and Ginger Sauce
ingredients_raw: ['Spring Onion', 'Fresh Ginger', 'Salt', 'MSG (optional)', 'Sugar', 'Vegetable Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Spring Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "MSG", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Vegetable Oil", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Finely slice the spring onions and mince the fresh ginger. Add the finely sliced spring onions and minced ginger to a heatproof bowl.
Stir in the salt, MSG (if using), and sugar.
Heat the vegetable oil in a small pan over high heat until smoking.
Carefully pour the hot oil over the spring onion mixture, allowing it to sizzle and release its aroma.
Stir well and let sit for at least 5 minutes before serving.

title: Herby Chicken, Pepper & Quinoa Salad
ingredients_raw: ['Quinoa', 'Water', 'Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh', 'Garlic Clove', 'Dijon Mustard', 'Lemon', 'Drained Roasted Red Pepper', 'White Onion', 'Fresh Mint', 'Balsamic Vinegar', 'Olive Oil', 'Cardamom Pod', 'Coriander Seed', 'Cumin Seeds', 'Green Chilli', 'Garlic', 'Coriander', 'Olive Oil', 'Lemon', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Quinoa", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Dijon Mustard", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Drained Roasted Red Pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "White Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Mint", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Balsamic Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cardamom Pod", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Coriander Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cumin Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Green Chilli", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Coriander", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Thinly slice the roasted peppers. Peel and finely slice the onion, then rinse it under cold water in a sieve until crisp. Pick the mint leaves. Toss the sliced onion, peppers, and mint together in a bowl with the balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Season well with salt and black pepper.
Rinse the quinoa under cold water until it runs clear. Tip into a saucepan with water and a good pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce the heat to low and cook for 15–20 mins, or until all the water is absorbed. Remove from the heat and let it steam with the lid on for 5 mins. Fluff with a fork.
Make the Zhoug dressing. Lightly crack the cardamom pods open using the back of your knife. Add the coriander seeds, cumin seeds and crushed cardamom pods into a small frying pan. Place on medium heat and toast until fragrant, 2-3 mins.
Remove the cardamom seeds and discard the pod.
Add the spices into a food processor or blender and blitz until they have broken down slightly (don’t let them become a fine powder). Trim the chillies and add them to the spices with the garlic clove, herbs (stems and all). Blend until broken down, then gradually add the olive oil, until emulsified. Taste and season with salt and pepper.
Place the chicken thighs in a bowl. Finely grate over the garlic, add the Dijon mustard and lemon juice, and season with salt and loads of black pepper. Mix well to coat. Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Fry the chicken for 10–15 mins, turning occasionally, until golden brown and cooked through. Rest for 5 mins, then slice.
Divide the quinoa between your containers. Top with sliced chicken and spoon over the pepper and mint salad. Serve with a pot of Zhoug dressing on the side.

title: Minty Pepper Salad
ingredients_raw: ['Drained Roasted Red Pepper', 'Fresh Mint', 'White Onion', 'Balsamic Vinegar']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Drained Roasted Red Pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "White Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Balsamic Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Drain and thinly slice the peppers. Trim and thinly slice the onion, place into a strainer and wash under cold running water until crisp. Pick the mint leaves. Add all of the onion, peppers, and mint to a bowl with the balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Toss and then let the flavours get to know each other.
Serve with your favourite mains and dressings.

title: Jalapeño Caesar Dressing
ingredients_raw: ['Mayonnaise', 'Anchovy', 'Lemon', 'Garlic Clove', 'Pickled Jalapeño', 'Jalapeño', 'Parmesan']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Anchovy", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Pickled Jalape\u00f1o", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Jalape\u00f1o", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Mayonnaise", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Parmesan", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Peel the garlic and finely chop the pickled jalapeños.
Add the garlic to a pestle and mortar (if you don't have one use a blender or just finely chop everything), smash the garlic then add the anchovies, smooshing them into a paste.
Add the jalapeños and keep smooshing until it comes together, then add the mayo and the lemon zest before juicing in half of the lemon – taste and adjust with the remaining lemon juice if needed. Grate in the Parmesan. Give it a good season with some black pepper and taste again. If you think it needs salt, add it.

title: Tomato Bulgur
ingredients_raw: ['Tomato Purée', 'Lemon', 'Water', 'Olive Oil', 'Pomegranate Molasses', 'Bulgur Wheat']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Tomato Pur\u00e9e", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Pomegranate Molasses", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Bulgur Wheat", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Pour the water and olive oil into a saucepan. Add the tomato purée and the pomegranate molasses, season with salt and bring the mixture to a boil.
Once boiling, tip the bulgur wheat in, let it come back to the boil, then cover and turn the heat down to low. Cook for 10 mins until the bulgur has absorbed the water.
Once absorbed, use a fork to fluff it up. Taste and season with the juice of a lemon and more salt, if needed.

title: Zhoug
ingredients_raw: ['Cardamom', 'Coriander Seed', 'Cumin Seed', 'Green Chilli', 'Garlic Clove', 'Coriander', 'Olive Oil', 'Lemon', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Cardamom", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Coriander Seed", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Cumin Seed", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Green Chilli", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Lightly crack the cardamom pods open using the back of your knife. Add the coriander seeds, cumin seeds and crushed cardamom pods into a small frying pan. Place on medium heat and toast until fragrant, 2-3 mins.
Remove the cardamom seeds and discard the pod.
Add the spices into a food processor or blender and blitz until they have broken down slightly (don’t let them become a fine powder). Trim the chillies and add them to the spices with the garlic clove, herbs (stems and all). Blend until broken down, then gradually add the olive oil, until emulsified. Taste and season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the zhoug into a clean airtight container, stir the lemon juice in and cover with a light layer of olive oil on top. Store in the fridge for up to 2 weeks.

title: Chicken & Cherry Tomato Barley Salad
ingredients_raw: ['Pearl Barley', 'Water', 'Flaky Sea Salt', 'Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh', 'Garlic Clove', 'Dijon Mustard', 'Lemon', 'Shallot', 'Red Wine Vinegar', 'Mixed Tomatoes', 'Cherry', 'Courgette', 'Fresh Dill', 'Green Cardamom Pod', 'Coriander Seed', 'Cumin Seeds', 'Fresh Green Chilli', 'Garlic Clove', 'Fresh Coriander', 'Olive Oil', 'Lemon', 'Flaky Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Pearl Barley", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Flaky Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Dijon Mustard", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Shallot", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Red Wine Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Mixed Tomatoes", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cherry", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Courgette", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Dill", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Green Cardamom Pod", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Coriander Seed", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cumin Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Green Chilli", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Coriander", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Flaky Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Rinse the pearl barley under cold water. Tip into a saucepan with water and a good pinch of salt. Bring to the boil, cover with a lid, reduce the heat to low, and cook for around 40 mins, or until tender. Add a splash more water if needed. Drain off any excess water and fluff with a fork.
Add the chicken to a bowl. Finely grate in the garlic, add the Dijon mustard and lemon juice. Season well with salt and plenty of black pepper. Mix to coat. Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Fry the chicken for 10–15 mins, turning occasionally, until golden and cooked through. Set aside to rest, then slice.
Peel and finely slice the shallots into rings. Tip into a bowl with the vinegar and let sit for 5 mins to lightly pickle. Roughly chop the tomatoes and add them to the bowl. Thinly slice the courgette and pit the cherries, then add both to the salad. Season well with salt and pepper, tear in the dill, and drizzle with a little olive oil. Let the salad sit for at least 30 mins to develop flavour.
Make the green chilli dressing. Crack open the cardamom pods and remove the seeds. Toast the cardamom seeds, cumin seeds, and coriander seeds in a dry pan over medium heat for 2–3 mins, until fragrant. Transfer to a blender and pulse until roughly broken down. Add the trimmed chillies, garlic, and fresh coriander. Blend while gradually pouring in the olive oil to emulsify. Squeeze in the lemon juice, season with salt and pepper, and blend again until smooth.
Divide the barley between containers. Top with sliced chicken and a generous spoonful of the tomato and cherry salad. Drizzle with the green chilli dressing or serve it on the side.

title: Melted Courgette Gnocchi Traybake with Tahini
ingredients_raw: ['Gnocchi', 'Courgette', 'Garlic Clove', 'Chilli Flakes', 'Tahini', 'Honey', 'Lemon', 'Sumac', 'Fresh Mint', 'Olive Oil', 'Sunflower Seeds', 'Flaky Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Gnocchi", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Courgette", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chilli Flakes", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Tahini", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Honey", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sumac", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Mint", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sunflower Seeds", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Flaky Sea Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 200°C fan.
Prep the courgettes. Cut them into irregular 3cm chunks. Spread onto a large roasting tray and toss with half of the olive oil and a sprinkling of salt.
Roast the courgettes for 10 mins. Remove the tray, give everything a shake, then add the gnocchi and roast for a further 5–8 mins until the courgettes are golden and the gnocchi is crisping at the edges.
Make the dressing. In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining olive oil, sumac, honey, the zest of the whole lemon, and the juice of half. Season well.
Once the tray is out of the oven, let it cool slightly, then toss the courgettes and gnocchi through the dressing.
Make the tahini sauce. Grate the garlic into a separate bowl. Add the tahini and remaining lemon juice. Stir with a splash of water until smooth and pourable. Season with salt and pepper.
Drizzle the garlic tahini sauce over the traybake, sprinkle with chilli flakes and sunflower seeds, and scatter over picked mint leaves.

title: Blistered Courgettes
ingredients_raw: ['Courgette', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Courgette", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Cut the courgettes into 3-4cm-thick coins.
Preheat a large frying pan and add a good amount of olive oil, enough to almost cover the base of the pan. Season the courgettes with salt and add to the pan, cut-side down. Cook over a high heat for 4-5 mins or until blistered and heavily charred. Carefully flip and cook on the other cut side for 2-3 mins. Remove from the heat and allow the courgettes to sit for 5 mins in the pan, letting the residual heat cook the courgettes through.
Serve the courgette coins with your favourite grain or carbohydrate.

title: Green Kefir Dressing
ingredients_raw: ['Anchovy', 'Avocado', 'Lime', 'Chive', 'Basil', 'Kefir', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Anchovy", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Avocado", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Lime", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chive", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Basil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Kefir", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Scoop the avocado into a blender. Add the chives, half the basil leaves, anchovies and lime juice with the olive oil, blend until smooth. Taste and season with salt and pepper.
Pour the kefir into the dressing, giving it a quick whizz until mixed. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Set aside in the fridge.

title: Chilli Crisp Tomatoes
ingredients_raw: ['Spring Onion', 'Cherry Tomatoes', 'Crispy Chilli Oil', 'Rice Vinegar']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Spring Onion", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cherry Tomatoes", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Crispy Chilli Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Rice Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Trim and thinly slice the spring onions, then chop the tomatoes into bite-sized chunks.
Put the chilli oil into a large bowl and stir through the rice vinegar. Season with salt, then add the tomatoes and spring onion. Toss well.
If batch cooking for the week, transfer the salad to a container and store in the fridge until ready to eat.

title: Sticky Nigella Halloumi
ingredients_raw: ['Nigella Seed', 'Coriander Seed', 'Black Pepper', 'Urfa Chilli Flake', 'Honey', 'Halloumi', 'Lemon', 'Olive Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Nigella Seed", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Coriander Seed", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Urfa Chilli Flake", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Honey", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Halloumi", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat oven to 180°C.
Place the nigella seeds, coriander seeds, pepper and urfa chilli flakes in a spice grinder or pestle and mortar and blitz or crush to a fine powder. Stir the spices through the honey and set aside.
Halve each block of halloumi so you're left with 4 thick pieces. Heat a dash of olive oil in a frying pan over a medium-high heat, then pan fry for 3-5 minutes on each side until golden and crisp. Transfer to the oven to heat through for 5 minutes. By this point, it should be gooey.
To serve, place a slice of halloumi on each plate and season with a little lemon juice and zest. Drizzle over the spiced honey and serve immediately.

title: Packed Lunch: Crispy Curry Tofu Noodles
ingredients_raw: ['Cornflour', 'Smoked Paprika', 'Firm Tofu', 'Fresh Ginger', 'Garlic Clove', 'Tomato Purée', 'Curry Powder', 'Smooth Peanut Butter', 'Vegetable Stock Powder', 'Ramen Noodle', 'Noodle Cooking Water', 'Olive Oil', 'Brussels Sprout', 'White Wine Vinegar', 'Red Chilli', 'Fresh Coriander', 'Sugar']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Cornflour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Smoked Paprika", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Firm Tofu", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Tomato Pur\u00e9e", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Curry Powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Smooth Peanut Butter", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Vegetable Stock Powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Ramen Noodle", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Noodle Cooking Water", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Brussels Sprout", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "White Wine Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Red Chilli", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Coriander", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sugar", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Heat the oven to 200°C fan. Stir the cornflour and smoked paprika together and season with salt.
Chop the tofu into 2cm squares then toss them through the cornflour mixture. Transfer to a baking tray lined with baking parchment and drizzle with oil. Bake for 20-30 mins, until golden and crispy.
Meanwhile, finely grate the ginger and garlic into a saucepan. Add a drizzle of olive oil and set the heat to medium. Once sizzling and fragrant, add the tomato purée and curry powder and cook, stirring, until the tomato purée has darkened. Transfer the mixture to a heatproof bowl then stir through the peanut butter and vegetable stock powder.
For the pickled slaw, finely shred the brussels sprouts. Pick the coriander leaves and finely slice the stems. Thinly slice the chilli. Place the sprouts, coriander stems and chilli into a bowl, pour the vinegar over and season the mix with salt, pepper and sugar to taste. Set aside to mingle.
Fill the empty saucepan with water and set it over a medium-high heat. Bring to a boil then add the ramen noodles and cook following packet instructions. Ladle the noodle water (the quantity stated in the ingredients list) into the peanut butter mixture and whisk until smooth.
To serve, divide the peanut sauce between bowls. Top with the noodles, crispy tofu and brussels sprout slaw.

title: Seedy Feta & Giant Couscous Salad
ingredients_raw: ['Giant Couscous', 'Spinach', 'Red Onion', 'Lemon', 'Fresh Parsley', 'Fresh Dill', 'Flaky Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper', 'Feta', 'Mixed Seeds', 'Courgette', 'Anchovy', 'Avocado', 'Lime', 'Fresh Chive', 'Fresh Basil', 'Kefir', 'Olive Oil', 'Flaky Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Giant Couscous", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Red Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Spinach", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Courgette", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Feta", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Mixed Seeds", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Anchovy", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Avocado", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Lime", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chive", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Basil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Kefir", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Bring a saucepan of salted water to the boil. Add the giant couscous and cook for 6 mins, or until tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. Finely slice the red onion and pick the parsley and dill. Toss the herbs and onion through the couscous with the spinach and a generous squeeze of lemon juice. Season well with salt and pepper.
Slice the courgettes into 3–4cm-thick coins. Heat a large frying pan over high heat and add enough olive oil to coat the base. Season the courgette coins with salt and place cut-side down into the pan. Fry for 4–5 mins until blistered and charred, then flip and cook the other side for 2–3 mins. Turn off the heat and leave them to sit in the pan for 5 mins.
Preheat the grill to high. Tip the seeds onto a plate and season with black pepper. Press each side of the feta into the seeds so they stick. Place the seeded feta on a baking tray, drizzle with olive oil, and grill for 3–4 mins until golden and lightly crisp.
Make the creamy green dressing. Add the avocado, anchovies, lime juice, chives, basil, kefir and olive oil to a blender. Blitz until smooth and creamy. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Spoon the couscous mixture into containers. Top with chunks of seedy feta and blistered courgette. Serve with the green dressing on the side.

title: Pearl Barley
ingredients_raw: ['Pearl Barley', 'Water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Pearl Barley", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Rinse the pearl barley. Place a saucepan on medium-high heat. Tip the barley and water in, let it come to the boil. Place a lid on, decrease the heat to low and cook for 40 mins, adding more water if needed.
Top the barley with your protein of choice.

title: Garlicky Mustard Chicken
ingredients_raw: ['Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh', 'Wholegrain Mustard', 'Garlic Clove', 'Dill', 'Olive Oil']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Wholegrain Mustard", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Dill", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Add the chicken thighs and mustard to a bowl. Grate over the garlic and drizzle over some oil. Season generously with salt and pepper and give it a good mix. Set aside.
Heat a frying pan with a drizzle of oil over a medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken and cook on both sides until slightly charred and cooked through.
Serve the chicken with your choice of carb and veg. Sprinkle over some fresh dill, if you like. If batch cooking for the week, transfer the chicken to a container and store in the fridge until ready to serve.

title: Turmeric Cauliflower
ingredients_raw: ['Cauliflower', 'Red Onion', 'Ground Turmeric', 'Ground Coriander', 'Olive Oil', 'Garlic Clove', 'Fresh Coriander', 'Chilli Oil', 'Sesame Seeds']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Cauliflower", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Red Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Ground Turmeric", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Ground Coriander", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chilli Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Heat the oven to 160°C. Cut the cauliflower into rough florets and add to a large roasting tray. Peel the onions and cut into chunky wedges, then add to the tray along with the whole garlic cloves, still in their skins. Add the spices and olive oil, toss well, then season well. Slide into the oven and bake for 30 mins.
If batch cooking for the week, let the cauliflower cool then transfer the to a container and store in the fridge until ready to eat. Serve with a drizzle of chilli oil, a scattering of coriander leaves and some sesame seeds.

title: Lunch Box: Crispy Tofu Noodle Salad with Wasabi Vinaigrette
ingredients_raw: ['Smoked Tofu', 'Cornflour', 'Curry Powder', 'Egg Noodle', 'Sesame Oil', 'Mangetout', 'Romaine Lettuce', 'Fresh Coriander', 'Radish', 'Soy Sauce', 'Light Brown Sugar', 'Rice Vinegar', 'Wasabi', 'Garlic Clove', 'Sesame Seeds']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Smoked Tofu", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Cornflour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Curry Powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Egg Noodle", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Mangetout", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Romaine Lettuce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Coriander", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Radish", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Soy Sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Light Brown Sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Rice Vinegar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Wasabi", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Garlic Clove", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Sesame Seeds", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Heat the oven to 200°C fan. Line a baking tray with baking parchment.
Dice the tofu into 2cm pieces. Mix the cornflour, curry powder, and a pinch of salt in a tray, then toss the tofu in the mix to coat evenly. Spread onto the tray, drizzle with sesame oil, and roast for 20-25 mins until crisp and golden.
Cook the noodles following pack instructions, then drain and rinse under cold water. Toss in a large bowl with ⅓ of the sesame oil to prevent sticking.
Cut the mange tout in half. Shred the romaine and roughly chop the coriander. Add to the noodles and toss to combine. Thinly slice the radishes and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, light brown sugar, rice vinegar, wasabi paste, and remaining sesame oil. Finely grate in the garlic and whisk until emulsified. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
Box or plate up the noodle salad and top with the crispy tofu, radishes and sesame seeds. If eating later, store the dressing separately in an airtight container. If eating now, drizzle the dressing over the top. Everything will keep well in the fridge for 3 days.

title: Herby Freekeh
ingredients_raw: ['Water', 'Cracked Freekeh', 'Fresh Parsley', 'Lemon', 'Salt', 'Black Pepper']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cracked Freekeh", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Fresh Parsley", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Lemon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Black Pepper", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Pour the water into a saucepan and bring to the boil. Stir through the freekeh, then put a lid on the saucepan and turn the heat down to low-medium. Simmer for 10-15 mins until the freekeh is cooked and has absorbed all the water.
Meanwhile, finely chop the parsley and zest the lemon. Once the freekeh has cooked and cooled a little, stir through both.

title: Crockpot Apple Dump Cake
ingredients_raw: ['2 cans Apple Pie Filling', '1 box Yellow Cake Mix', '1/2 cup butter melted', '1 tsp cinnamon', '1/2 cup pecans chopped; optional']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Apple Pie Filling", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Yellow Cake Mix", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Cinnamon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Pecans", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
In a 5-6 quart crockpot dump the 2 cans of apple pie filling. In a bowl mix together the cake mix, cinnamon, pecans, and melted butter. Crumble the cake mix over the apple pie filling.
Cover and cook on high for 2 hours.
Serve warm with ice cream
Use a gluten free cake mix
Use coconut oil or vegetable oil instead of butter. Use a dairy free cake mix.

title: Crockpot Grape Jelly & BBQ Little Smokies
ingredients_raw: ['32 oz Cocktail Sausages equiv 2 packages', '1 cup bbq sauce', '3/4 cup grape jelly']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Cocktail Sausages", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "bbq sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "grape jelly", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Dump all of the ingredients in a lined four quart or larger crockpot.
Turn on low for 2 -3 hours.
Stir before serving.

title: Crockpot Stuffed Pepper Soup
ingredients_raw: ['2 lbs ground beef', '2 green bell peppers diced ( about 1 cup)', '30 oz diced tomatoes 2 cans; undrained', '15 oz tomato sauce', '32 oz beef broth', '1 cup water', '1 small onion diced', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', '3-4 cloves garlic minced', '2 tsp salt', '1 tsp pepper', '2 cups cooked rice']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "ground beef", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "green bell peppers", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "diced tomatoes", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "tomato sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "beef broth", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "small onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "brown sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cooked rice", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Brown and drain grease from the ground beef and place in slow cooker.
Add in tomato sauce, tomatoes, broth, peppers, onions, garlic, brown sugar, water, salt and pepper to slow cooker. (basically everything but your cooked rice) Cover and cook on low 6-8 hours.
When about 30 minutes are left , add in your cooked rice, recover and continue cooking until time is up.

title: Crockpot Biscuits & Gravy
ingredients_raw: ['1 lb pork sausage', '2 tablespoons butter', '1/4 cup flour', '3 cups milk', 'salt and pepper', '1 can refrigerator biscuits 8 ct']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "pork sausage", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "flour", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "milk", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salt and pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "refrigerator biscuits", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
In a large skillet brown pork sausage and break it into crumbles. Remove sausage from skillet and into a bowl, leaving the fat in the skillet.
Add 2 tbsp of butter to the skillet and melt over medium heat. Stir in the flour to create a roux. Cook until golden brown. Whisk in the milk, salt & pepper.
Heat the milk mixture over medium heat whisking constantly until it comes to a boil. The mixture will thicken. Remove from heat.
In a large crockpot (preferably a casserole crockpot or 6 qt) pour in the gravy. Dump in the cooked sausage and stir.
Open a can of refrigerator biscuits and place them one at a time on top of the gravy to form a top crust.
Cover and cook on high for 2 hours. Keep warm until ready to serve.

title: Crockpot French Toast Casserole
ingredients_raw: ['1 loaf bread diced (stale works great)', '6 eggs', '2 cups milk Dairy Free Alternative can be used', '1/2 tsp cinnamon', '1/4 cup butter or Dairy Free Margarine Softened', '1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar', '1 tsp cinnamon', '1/2 cup chopped pecans', 'Dash of nutmeg']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "bread diced", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "eggs", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "milk", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cinnamon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "brown sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "pecans", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "nutmeg", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Whisk together eggs, milk and cinnamon and pour over diced bread in a large bowl. Cover an let it soak overnight in the fridge or atleast 4 hours.
When ready to bake spray the inside of the crockpot (4-6 quart sized works best) to avoid sticking.
Pour in Bread Mix.
In a small bowl mix together butter, brown sugar cinnamon, pecans and nutmeg.
Crumble of the top of the bread mix. Cover and Cook on low for 4 hours…or if you are in a hurry High for 2 hours.
Let sit for 15-20 minutes and serve!

title: Crockpot Salisbury Steak
ingredients_raw: ['1 lb. Ground Beef', '1/2 cup Bread Crumbs seasoned', '1/2 tsp. Salt', '1/2 tsp. Pepper', '1 Egg', 'Small Onion diced; about 1 cup (Optional)', '14 oz Beef Broth or half a carton', '4 oz Mushrooms Sliced & Drained', '2 tablespoons Cornstarch', '2 tablespoons Water', '1 packet Brown Gravy Mix or 1 – Jar/Can Brown Gravy']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Ground Beef", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Bread Crumbs seasoned", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Egg", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Beef Broth", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Mushrooms", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Cornstarch", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Brown Gravy Mix", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Mashed potatoes", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Mix First 5 ingredients together and shape into patties about ¾ inches thick.
Cook patties in a skillet turning once until brown.
Remove from Skillet and place in crockpot or casserole dish.
Add onion mushroom and beef broth; heat to boiling.
Mix water and cornstarch together to make a paste.
Add to boiling mixture with a wire whisk and whisk until gravy begins to thicken.
Add a packet of Mushroom or Brown Gravy Mix and water packet calls for to gravy in skillet. Trust me, you will need the extra gravy (or you can add a jar of premade).
I then poured the gravy over the meat patties and cooked on low for atleast 3 hours.
You could also bake in oven at 350 for about 30 minutes.
Serve with Mashed potatoes.
Makes 4 servings…depending how hungry you are you?
Use gluten free gravy and gluten free bread crumbs.

title: Crockpot Chicken & Mushrooms
ingredients_raw: ['1 1/2 lbs Chicken Breasts', '2 tbsp olive oil', '16 ounce mushrooms sliced', '1 onion diced, medium', '2 cloves garlic minced', '1 1/2 cups chicken broth', '2 tbsp cornstarch', 'salt and pepper to taste', 'fresh parsley chopped ; optional']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Chicken Breasts", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Olive Oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Mushrooms", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Chicken Broth", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cornstarch", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Parsley", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
In a medium skillet, add oil and chicken. Cook on medium-high heat and sear until brown, flip, and brown the other side. Place in slow cooker.
In the same pan, add onion and saute until tender. Add to slow cooker.
Place the mushrooms, garlic, and parsley in an even layer over the chicken and onions in the slow cooker. Pour in chicken broth and sprinkle with salt and pepper and cook on low for 4 hours.
Remove the chicken from the slow cooker, and add cornstarch to the juices and mushrooms. Whisk until smooth. Return chicken to slow cooker and cook until the gravy is thick about 20 minutes.
Serve over rice or pasta!

title: Slow Cooker Chicken Alfredo
ingredients_raw: ['1 tablespoons avocado oil', '1 ½ pounds chicken breast boneless skinless', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon garlic powder', '¼ teaspoon onion powder', '¼ teaspoon dried parsley', '⅛ teaspoon pepper', '2 teaspoons fresh garlic minced', '4 cups chicken broth', '3 cups heavy cream', '4 tablespoons butter', '12 oz uncooked penne pasta gluten free if necessary', '5 oz fresh parmesan grated', 'salt to taste', 'fresh parsley to garnish Optional']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "avocado oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chicken breast", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chicken broth", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "heavy cream", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "pasta", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
In a small bowl, add the salt, garlic powder, onion powder, dried parsley and pepper. Stir to combine. Season both sides of chicken.
Heat a large cast iron skillet on medium-high heat for 5 minutes. Add avocado oil. Once oil is heated through, sear the chicken for 2-3 minutes each side. Remove the chicken from the skillet and place in the bottom of the slow cooker.
Add minced garlic to the hot skillet and stir, cooking for 1 minute or until fragrant. Deglaze the pan by adding 1 cup of chicken broth. Use a wooden spoon to scrape the brown bits off the bottom of the pan. Allow the liquid to come to a simmer before pouring the broth over the chicken.
Add the heavy cream, remaining chicken broth, and butter to the slow cooker.
Cover the slow cooker and cook for 2-3 hours on high or 4 hours on low. Chicken is done when it reaches 165 degrees F.
Once cooked, remove chicken from the slow cooker and place on a cutting board. Slice the chicken into bite size pieces and set aside.
Add the uncooked penne pasta to the slow cooker and cook on high for an additional 20-30 minutes or until pasta is tender.
Once pasta is cooked, stir in the sliced chicken and freshly grated parmesan cheese. Taste and add additional salt and/or pepper if needed.
Serve warm topped with fresh parsley and additional parmesan cheese if desired.

title: Crockpot Taco Tater Tot Casserole
ingredients_raw: ['2 ½ pounds ground beef', '1 onion diced', '15 oz Black Beans canned, drained', '16 oz salsa jarred or fresh', '2 tablespoons taco seasoning or 1 packet', '32 oz frozen tater tots', '1 cup shredded fiesta blend cheese or cheddar', 'Cilantro for garnish']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "ground beef", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "black beans", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salsa", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "taco seasoning", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "tater tots", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "fiesta blend cheese", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the ground beef and onion until the beef has browned and crumbled. Drain well and return to the skillet.
To the meat, add the black beans, salsa, and taco seasoning, stirring well.
Spread half of the tater tots onto the bottom of the slow cooker liner. Then, add the ground beef mixture followed by another layer of tater tots.
Cover and cook on low for 3 to 4 hours.
With 30 minutes cooking time remaining, add the cheese over the tater tots.
Prior to serving, top with chopped cilantro.
Serve with sour cream, guacamole, and salsa if desired.

title: Crockpot Mississippi Pot Roast
ingredients_raw: ['4 lb beef chuck roast', '1-2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 oz ranch dressing mix', '1 oz au jus gravy mix', '½ cup pepperoncini juice', '6-8 pepperoncini peppers', '¼ cup butter , cut into slices', 'Salt and pepper to taste']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "beef chuck roast", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "olive oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "pepperoncini juice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "pepperoncini peppers", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "butter", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat
Place roast in skillet and brown on each side for about 5 minutes
Transfer roast to crock pot
Pour juice over roast
Sprinkle with ranch dressing and gravy mixes
Add peppers and sliced butter on top of roast
Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours or until tender
Serve with mashed potatoes

title: Crockpot Banana Cake
ingredients_raw: ['1 Yellow Cake Mix Prepared', '1 1/3 cup Mashed Banana Roughly 3 medium bananas', '1 tsp cinnamon', '1/2 cup pecans chopped', '1 1/2 cups frosting']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Yellow Cake Mix Prepared", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Mashed Banana", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Cinnamon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Pecans", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Frosting", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Prepare your crockpot by lining it with parchment paper or spraying it with a non-stick spray.
Prepare your cake mix according to the package instructions.
Mix in the mashed banana and cinnamon to the prepared cake batter.
Stir in the pecans.
Pour into prepared crockpot and spread evenly.
Stretch paper towels under the lid when covering so they fit tightly. This will catch extra moisture to prevent a soggy cake.
Cook on high for 2 hours or low for 4 hours. Check your cake 30 minutes before the finishing time to evaluate its doneness. It may need slightly more or less time depending on the slow cooker. You want a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake to come out clean and for the cake to be firm.
Once the cake is baked, unplug the slow cooker and remove the lid to allow the cake to cool. When it has cooled, ice the cake with your favorite frosting.
Slice and enjoy!
For a gluten free cake use a gluten free cake mix.

title: Crockpot Venison Pot Roast
ingredients_raw: ['2 ½ pounds venison roast can substitute with beef', '1 tablespoons steak seasoning', '1 tablespoon cooking oil', '4 cloves garlic minced', '1 onion chopped', '1 cup beef stock', '2 tablespoons worcestershire', '½ teaspoon onion powder']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "venison roast", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "steak seasoning", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "beef stock", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "worcestershire", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "onion powder", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Dry the roast with paper towels. Coat meat in steak seasoning and set aside.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a skillet on medium-high heat. Sear roasts for 4 minutes each side, then transfer to crock pot.
Add minced garlic and chopped onion to the hot skillet. Cook for 1 minute.
Deglaze the pan by adding 1 cup of beef stock. Use a wooden spoon to stir and scrape the brown bits from the bottom of the pan.
Stir in worcestershire and onion powder. Turn off the heat and add the mixture to the slow cooker, pouring right on top of the roasts.
Cook on high for 1 ½ hours. Turn the slow cooker down to low heat and cook for an additional 2 ½ to 3 hours. Use two forks to shred the meat. Serve warm with mashed potatoes if desired.

title: Crockpot Hoppin John Recipe
ingredients_raw: ['1 ham bone, with meat or about 3 cups leftover ham meat', '28 oz frozen black eyed peas', '1 medium onion diced', '2 stalks celery diced', '1 green bell pepper seeded and diced', '3 cloves garlic minced', '2 bay leaves', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', '¼ to ½ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes according to your tastes', '1 teaspoon salt', '6 cups chicken broth', '15 oz diced tomatoes with green chilies canned', '3 cups rice uncooked']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "ham bone", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "ham meat", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "black eyed peas", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "celery", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "green bell pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "bay leaves", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "thyme", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "red pepper flakes", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chicken broth", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "diced tomatoes with green chilies", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "rice", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Place ham in a slow cooker and top with all other ingredients EXCEPT for the rice. Stir to combine.
Cover the slow cooker and cook on high for 3 hours.
Carefully remove the ham and shred it between two forks. Return the ham to the slow cooker and add the rice. Push the rice below the liquid line to make sure it cooks.
Cover and continue cooking for an additional 2 hours on high or until the rice is tender.
Prior to serving, stir and remove the bay leaves.

title: Slow Cooker Carnitas
ingredients_raw: ['3-4 pound pork shoulder trimmed slightly', '1 ½ teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '2 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon black pepper', '1 onion small , diced', '3 cloves garlic minced', '⅓ cup orange juice', '2 teaspoon orange peel finely shredded', '⅓ cup lime juice', '1 chipotle pepper in adobo sauce chopped', '1-2 tablespoons oil – vegetable or canola']
