ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "pork shoulder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "orange juice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "lime juice", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chipotle pepper", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "oil", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
In a small bowl, whisk together the dried oregano, cumin, salt and pepper
Rub seasoning mixture onto pork shoulder on all sides
Add onion, garlic, orange juice and peel, lime juice and chipotle pepper to slow cooker
Place pork on top
Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours or until internal temperature is 145 degrees F
Remove pork from slow cooker onto cutting board, let cool slightly
Shred pork with forks
Heat oil in skillet on stove ** see notes
Add pork and some of the juice from the slow cooker
Turn often to brown the pork until juices have evaporated and pork is nicely browned
Repeat with more pork if your skillet doesn’t hold all of it
Serve immediately with tortillas and toppings
Store leftovers in refrigerator

title: Crockpot Bacon & Cheese Potatoes
ingredients_raw: ['1/4 pound bacon diced', '2 onions thinly sliced', '4 potatoes thinly sliced', '1/2 pound cheddar cheese thinly sliced', 'salt and pepper', 'butter', 'Green Onions optional']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "bacon", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "onions", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "potatoes", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cheddar cheese", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salt and pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Green Onions", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Line crockpot with foil, leaving enough to cover the potatoes when finished.
Layer half each of the bacon, onions, potatoes and cheese in crockpot. Season to taste and dot with butter.
Repeat layers of bacon, onions, potatoes and cheese. Dot with butter.
Cover with remaining foil.
Cover and cook on low for 10-12 hours.

title: Slow Cooker Cadbury Creme Egg Chocolate Cake
ingredients_raw: ['1 ¾ cups all purpose flour or gluten free flour mix', '¾ cups unsweetened cocoa powder', '1 ½ teaspoon baking soda', '1 ½ teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 cups sugar', '2 eggs', '1 cup milk', '1/2 cup vegetable oil', '2 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 cup boiling water', '6 to 8 Cadbury Creme eggs', 'Mini Cadbury Creme eggs if desired']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "all purpose flour or gluten free flour mix", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "unsweetened cocoa powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "baking soda", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "baking powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "eggs", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "milk", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "vegetable oil", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "vanilla extract", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "boiling water", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Cadbury Creme eggs", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Mini Cadbury Creme eggs", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Spray the liner of a 6 to 8 quart slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray.
In a large bowl, whisk together the dry ingredients: flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cocoa, and sugar.
In a medium bowl, beat the eggs slightly. Add the milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract, whisking until well blended.
Very slowly, add the water to the milk mixture while whisking.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until combined.
Transfer the batter to the slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 3 to 3 ½ hours, depending on the size of the slow cooker, or until the top of the cake is no longer wet.
Turn off the slow cooker and remove the lid.
Coarsely chop the Cadbury eggs and sprinkle over the top of the cake. If desired, drop mini Cadbury eggs over the cake. Allow to melt as the cake cools.
This cake can be served completely cooled or warm.

title: Crockpot Chocolate Lava Cake
ingredients_raw: ['1 box chocolate cake mix prepared', '1 box Instant chocolate pudding mix 3oz, prepared according to package', '1 cup semi sweet chocolate chips']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "chocolate cake mix", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chocolate pudding mix", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "semi sweet chocolate chips", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
In a 5 quart or larger crockpot spray it with cooking spray.
Pour in your prepared chocolate cake mix batter.
Spoon the prepared chocolate pudding over the top of the cake mix in large spoonfulls.
Sprinkle the entire cake with chocolate chips.
Cover and cook on low for 2 to 2 1/2 hours depending on your crockpot.
Spoon in a bowl to serve with a dollop of vanilla ice cream or whipped cream!
Use a gluten free chocoalte cake mix, and be mindful that your other ingredients are also gluten free
Use a dairy free cake mix. Also, check your pudding mix to make sure it is dairy free (most are).
Use a dairy free milk alternative like almond milk or coconut milk, however only use half of the called for amount. Example: if the box calls for 2 cups use 1 cup.
Finally use a dairy free chocolate chip. We prefer Enjoy Life brand.

title: Crockpot Coffee Cake
ingredients_raw: ['2 cups all-purpose flour', '3/4 cup white sugar', '2 teaspoon baking powder', '1/2 teaspoon salt', '1/2 cup butter', '1 egg', '3/4 cup milk or as needed', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1/4 cup all-purpose flour', '2/3 cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1/4 cup butter']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "all-purpose flour", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "white sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "baking powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "egg", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "milk", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "vanilla extract", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "all-purpose flour", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "white sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "ground cinnamon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "butter", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
In a medium bowl, combine 1/4 cup flour, 2/3 cup sugar, and 1 teaspoon cinnamon. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Set aside.Cake
In a large bowl, combine 2 cups flour, 3/4 cup sugar, baking powder, and salt. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Crack an egg into a measuring cup and then fill add milk to make 1 cup. Stir in vanilla. Pour into crumb mixture and mix just until moistened.
Spread cake batter into a parchment lined 5 quart or larger crockpot. Sprinkle top with streusel.
Cover and cook on high for 2 – 2 1/2 hours or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Carefully remove the cake using the parchment paper and let it cool on a baking rack. Serve.

title: Classic Vanilla Cake
ingredients_raw: ['2 ¼ cups cake flour', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '½ teaspoon baking soda', '½ teaspoon kosher salt', '1 ¼ cups buttermilk (room temperature)', '1 tablespoon vanilla bean paste', '2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', '12 tablespoons unsalted butter (room temperature)', '1 ½ cups granulated sugar', '3 large eggs (room temperature)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "vanilla bean paste", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "vanilla extract", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "eggs", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "baking powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "baking soda", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350°F with a rack in the center. Grease (2) 8- or 9-inch round cake pans and line with parchment.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, or with a hand mixer, beat the butter and sugar at medium speed for 3 minutes, or until the butter and sugar are very light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, making sure they are fully mixed in before adding the next. Beat in vanilla paste and extract.
Add 1/3 of the flour mixture, beating on low speed. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl. Beat in half of the buttermilk, then beat in half of the remaining dry ingredients until well incorporated. Add the rest of the buttermilk, beating until the batter is fully incorporated and smooth, then add the last of the dry ingredients, beating until the ingredients are thoroughly combined, scraping the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.
Divide the batter equally between the prepared cake pans.
Bake for 25-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the centers comes out clean. Let cool briefly in the pans, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely before topping with desired frosting and decorating.

title: Raspberry Buttercream Frosting
ingredients_raw: ['2 cups unsalted butter (room temperature)', "1.5 pounds confectioners' sugar (24 ounces or about 5.5 cups, sifted)", '2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', '4-5 tablespoons raspberry jam']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "unsalted butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "confectioners' sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "vanilla extract", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "raspberry jam", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium-high speed for about 5 minutes.
Turn the mixer down to low speed and gradually add in the confectioners' sugar until it is completely incorporated. Add in vanilla and 3 tablespoons of the raspberry jam; mix until incorporated. Turn off the mixer and check the buttercream for taste and texture and scrape down the sides of the bowl. Gradually add in the last 2 tablespoons of raspberry jam until you reach the desired level of raspberry flavor. (Please note that adding more than the recommended 5 tablespoons could result in a thinner frosting.) Turn the mixer back up to medium-high speed and beat the mixture for about 3-4 minutes or until light and fluffy.
Spread or pipe onto cake or cupcakes.

title: Cherry Cheesecake Cookies
ingredients_raw: ['1 1/4 cups finely crushed graham crackers (about 1 sleeve)', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder', '12 tablespoons unsalted butter (softened)', '1/2 cup packed light brown sugar', '1 egg (separated)', '4 ounces cream cheese (softened)', '1/4 cup granulated sugar', '1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', 'homemade cherry pie filling']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "finely crushed graham crackers", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "all-purpose flour", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "baking powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "unsalted butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "light brown sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "egg (separated)", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cream cheese (softened)", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "granulated sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "pure vanilla extract", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "homemade cherry pie filling", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.
In a large bowl, whisk together the graham cracker crumbs, flour and baking powder.
In a medium bowl, with an electric mixer, beat together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy; about 2 minutes. Add the egg white and beat until well combined.
Stir graham cracker mixture into butter mixture until just combined.
In another medium bowl, beat together the cream cheese and granulated sugar until combined. Add in egg yolk and vanilla and mix until smooth.
Using a medium cookie scoop (about 1.5 to 2 tablespoons), scoop out the cookie dough and place on prepared baking sheets. Press your thumb or a round measuring teaspoon into the center of the ball to flatten slightly and create a small bowl shape. Repeat with the remaining dough.
Spoon or pipe the cream cheese mixture into the indents of the cookies.
Bake in preheated oven for 12 minutes or until the filling is barely set and the cookies are lightly golden.
Allow to cool 5 minutes on the baking sheets before removing them and cooling completely on a wire rack.
Spoon cherry pie filling onto cooled cookies just before serving.

title: Easy Monkey Bread
ingredients_raw: ['3 cans refrigerated buttermilk biscuit dough (16 ounces each)', '1 cup granulated sugar', '2 tablespoons cinnamon', '¾ cup heavy cream', '½ cup unsalted butter', '½ cup lightly packed light brown sugar', 'Pinch of fine sea salt', '2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "3 cans refrigerated buttermilk biscuit dough", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "1 cup granulated sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "2 tablespoons cinnamon", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "\u00be cup heavy cream", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "\u00bd cup unsalted butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "\u00bd cup lightly packed light brown sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Pinch of fine sea salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray (1) 10-cup or 12-cup bundt pan with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.
Open the cans of biscuits and use a sharp knife to cut each biscuit into quarters.
Add the granulated sugar and cinnamon to a gallon-size zip-top bag, shaking to combine. Add the biscuit pieces and shake to coat in the cinnamon-sugar mixture. (Do this in batches if needed.)
Transfer the coated biscuit pieces to the bundt pan, arranging evenly. Slowly pour the heavy cream over the top. Allow to rest at least 5 minutes while you work on the syrup.
Add the butter and brown sugar to a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the butter is melted and the mixture just starts to bubble around the edges. Remove from the heat and stir in the salt and vanilla extract.
Slowly drizzle the syrup over the top of the biscuit pieces.
Place the bundt pan on a rimmed baking sheet. Bake for 45-55 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the biscuit pieces reads at least 200℉ on an instant read thermometer.
Let rest for 5-10 minutes before turning out onto a platter.

title: Black Forest Cheesecake
ingredients_raw: ['20 Oreo cookies (crushed in a food processor until they form fine crumbs)', '3 tablespoons unsalted butter (melted)', '32 ounces cream cheese (room temperature)', '½ cup granulated sugar', '4 large eggs (room temperature)', '2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', '½ cup heavy cream', '2 cups semisweet chocolate chips', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', 'Homemade cherry pie filling', 'whipped cream', 'chocolate shavings']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Oreo cookies", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "unsalted butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cream cheese", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "granulated sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "eggs", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "vanilla extract", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "heavy cream", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "semisweet chocolate chips", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "all-purpose flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "homemade cherry pie filling", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "whipped cream", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "chocolate shavings", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Tightly wrap a 9 inch springform pan in heavy duty foil. This step prevents leaks when using a water bath. I also take the extra step by placing the foil wrapped spring form pan inside an oven bag while baking, but this is optional (see recipe notes below for more info on this process). Lightly spray the springform pan with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.
Mix together the Oreo cookie crumbs and butter and press them into the bottom of your pan. Bake in preheated oven for 8 minutes and place on a wire rack to cool.
Begin to boil a pot or kettle of water for the water bath.
In a small saucepan over medium heat, warm the heavy cream until very hot, but not boiling. Place chocolate chips in a heat safe bowl. Pour the hot cream over the chocolate and allow it to sit for about 3-4 minutes. Whisk the cream and chocolate until smooth and thoroughly combined. Set aside to cool while you prepare the filling.
In the bowl of your stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese until smooth. Add sugar and mix until combined. Add eggs, one at a time, fully incorporating each before adding the next. Make sure to scrape down the bowl in between each egg. Add vanilla and mix until combined.
Add in the chocolate mixture and beat until it is fully incorporated into the cheesecake filling. Add in the flour and mix until combined. Scrape down the sides of your bowl and beat again until the mixture is completely smooth.
Pour batter onto the prepared crust. Place prepared pan(s) into a larger pan – like a roasting pan and pour boiling water into the larger pan until halfway up the side of the cheesecake pan. Bake for 60-70 minutes. The edges will appear to be set, but the center will still have a slight jiggle to it. At this point, turn off the oven, but leave the door cracked and allow the cheesecake to rest in the cooling oven for one hour.
After one hour has passed, carefully remove the cheesecake from the water bath and place on a cooling rack to cool completely. Once the cake is completely cooled, place it into the refrigerator for at least 8 hours.
Before serving, top with cherry pie filling, whipped cream and chocolate shavings.

title: Nana's Easy Cheesecake
ingredients_raw: ['2 cups all-purpose flour', '1 cup unsalted butter (room temperature)', '3 tablespoons granulated sugar', 'pinch of salt', '24 ounces cream cheese (3 packages, room temperature)', '2 ¼ cups powdered sugar', '2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', '2 21-ounce cans cherry pie filling or other flavor of choice', '8 ounces container of Cool Whip or TruWhip (thawed according to package directions)']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "all-purpose flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "unsalted butter", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "granulated sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cream cheese", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "powdered sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "vanilla extract", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cherry pie filling", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Cool Whip", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°F and line a 9x13-inch pan with foil or parchment paper and spray with nonstick cooking spray.
In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine flour, butter, sugar and salt until combined - mixture will be crumbly. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan and use your hands to press the dough into an even layer in the pan. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove pan from oven and to a cooling rack to cool completely.
Once the crust has cooled, add the cream cheese to the stand mixer bowl and beat at medium speed for 4-5 minutes until light and fluffy. Add in the powdered sugar and vanilla and beat for an additional 3-4 minutes. Spread filling onto cooled crust. Top with pie filling, followed with Cool Whip. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.

title: Mini Cheesecakes
ingredients_raw: ['4 whole graham cracker sheets', '2 tablespoons granulated sugar', '3 tablespoons unsalted butter (melted)', '16 ounces cream cheese (room temperature)', '1/2 cup granulated sugar', '2 large eggs', '1 teaspoon vanilla bean paste or vanilla extract', 'Pie filling or fruit sauce of your choice (cherry, blueberry, lemon curd, strawberry sauce, etc.)', 'Salted caramel sauce', 'Chocolate ganache', 'Fresh fruit']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "graham cracker sheets", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "unsalted butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cream cheese", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salted caramel sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chocolate ganache", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a standard cupcake pan with paper cupcake liners.
Place graham crackers into the bowl of a food processor fitted with a metal blade. Pulse until they form fine crumbs. Add 2 tablespoons sugar and melted butter and pulse until all the ingredients are evenly distributed.
Evenly distribute the crumb mixture in the bottom of each baking cup. Press gently to form an even crust.
Bake crusts in preheated oven for 5 minutes. Place pan on wire rack to cool while you prepare the filling.
Beat cream cheese and sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until well mixed - about 2 minutes. Add eggs in one at a time and mix until incorporated. Scrape the sides of the mixing bowl and add in the vanilla bean paste or vanilla extract and mix until it is incorporated. Use a large cookie scoop (about 3 tablespoons) to evenly distribute the filling into baking cups.
Bake for 15-17 minutes or until just set. Allow cheesecakes to cool completely on a wire rack and then refrigerate for at least 3 hours. Just before serving, top with the pie filling or sauce of your choice.

title: Marble Butter Cake
ingredients_raw: ['280 g low protein flour (cake flour) (2 cups)', '1 tsp baking powder', '250 g butter (salted, softened)', '100 g fine granulated sugar (½ cup)', '½ tsp salt', '½ tsp vanilla essence (optional)', '4 egg yolks (grade A)', '120 ml milk (½ cup)', '10 g cocoa powder (1 tbsp + 2 tsp)', '4 egg whites (grade A)', '100 g fine granulated sugar']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "low protein flour", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "baking powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "butter", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "fine granulated sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "vanilla essence", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "egg yolks", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "milk", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cocoa powder", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "egg whites", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
sieve flour
Mix and sieve together baking powder and low protein flour.
Beat butter
Combine butter, sugar, salt and vanilla in a mixing bowl, then beat over medium speed until light and fluffy.
Add in egg yolks gradually, beat until fully combined before adding another.
add in ¼ flour
Add in ¼ part of sieved flour, mix until combined.
add in ¼ milk
Add in ¼ part of milk, mix until combined.
Repeat same steps
Repeat the same steps until all flour and milk have been added, the continue folding until the batter is well mixed.
Preheat oven to 160°C/320°F (you may add a tray of water in the oven to increase the humidity, which can help preventing the cake surface from cracking).
whisk egg whites until soft peak
In another clean mixing bowl, whisk egg whites until soft peak.
whisk until stiff peak
Add in sugar gradually, continue whisking until stiff peak (the peaks will point straight up and hold).
whisking slowly for 1 minute
Continue whisking slowly for 1 minute to reduce the size of air bubbles (to reduce the holes in cake).
Add ⅓ meringue
Add ⅓ part of meringue to batter, mix gently using balloon whisk.
fold in meringue
Divide the remaining meringue into 2 batches, fold in gently using rubber spatula until well mixed.
cocoa batter
Take out 300 g of batter, sieve in cocoa powder and mix well.
pour batter alternatively into pan
Pour plain batter and cocoa batter alternatively into an 8″ (20-cm) square baking pan (greased and lined).
Swirl for marble effect
Swirl the batter using icing spatula to create a marble effect, then drop the baking pan on table for 3-4 times to burst large air bubbles.
bake
Bake at 160°C/320°F for 45 minutes, then increase to 180°C/355°F and continue baking for 10-15 minutes, or until fully cooked. (Reminder: The heat for different oven is different, the suggested time is only for reference, adjust the baking time base on your oven if necessary.)
remove from oven
The cake is done when the wooden stick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.
cool in pan
Let the cake cools in the baking pan for 10 minutes before unmoulding.
cools on wire rack
After unmoulding, let the cake cools on wire rack for 30-35 minutes before serving.

title: Traditional Mooncake With Lotus Seed Paste Filling
ingredients_raw: ['100 g low protein flour (cake flour)', '60 g golden syrup', '30 g cooking oil', '½ tsp alkaline water (lye water)', '460 g lotus seed paste (4 x 115g each)', 'white melon seed (adequate)', '4 salted egg yolks', '1 egg yolk', '1 tbsp milk']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "golden syrup", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "alkaline water", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "lotus seed paste", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "white melon seed", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salted egg yolks", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "rose cooking wine", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dough", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "mooncake mould", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "egg wash", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Ingredients for making traditional mooncake are surprisingly simple.
Mix golden syrup, cooking oil and alkaline water. Sieve in flour and mix well until all ingredients fully combined into dough. Do not over knead/mix.
Wrap with cling wrap, rest the dough for 2 hours.
Roast some white melon seeds at 160°C/320°F for 5 minutes.
Mix salted egg yolks with 1 tbsp. of rose cooking wine (or any cooking wine) to remove unpleasant smell from salted egg yolks, steam for 5 minutes.
Mix lotus seed paste with some melon seed, place a salty egg yolk in the middle and roll into round shape.
Place dough between cling warp and roll out evenly into 2-3mm thin disc shape with a rolling pin.
Wrap mooncake filling with dough.
Shape mooncake with mooncake mould (lightly oiled).
Bake in preheated oven at 160°C/320°F for 10 minutes. Spray mooncake with some water to avoid crust from cracking during the baking process.
Remove from oven and brush with egg wash.
Bake for another 10 minutes or until golden brown.
Crust of Mooncake will become glossy with softer texture after 2-3 days in air-tight container and ready to be served.

title: Homemade Smooth Red Bean Paste Recipe
ingredients_raw: ['150 g red bean', '600 ml water', '200 g granulated sugar', '30 g cooking oil (about 2¼ tbsps )', '10 g glutinous rice flour (+ 2 tbsps water)', '¼ tsp of salt']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "red bean", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "glutinous rice flour", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Wash and rinse red bean, soak overnight in the refrigerator. Soaking dry bean overnight will shorten the cooking time.
Drain and add in 600ml water, bring to the boil, reduce to low heat and cook for 2 hours.
Puree the cooked red bean until smooth using a blender.
Sieve the red bean for smoother paste texture.
Add sugar(200 g), salt(¼ tsp), cooking oil(30 g) and slaked glutinous rice flour to pureed red bean, mix until blended.
Cook over medium heat until smooth and shiny paste formed, stirring constantly (about 35 minutes).
Red bean paste can be prepared in advance, put in container and freeze it. Return frozen paste to room temperature before using.

title: Homestyle Fried Mee Hoon
ingredients_raw: ['120 g rice vermicelli/mee hoon', '½ tsp fine salt', '1 tsp dark soy sauce', 'about 4 tbsps prawn stock*', '2 eggs (grade A/size: L)', '⅛ tsp fine salt', '⅛ tsp white pepper', '½ tbsps cooking oil', '100 g prawn (shelled & deveined)', '230 g chicken breast meat (sliced)', '½ tsp white pepper', '½ tsp fine salt', '1 tsp sugar', '1 tsp cornstarch', '1 tsp sesame oil', '30 g chopped garlic', '3 tbsps cooking oil', '100 g cabbage', '120 g choy sum', '50 g carrot (julienned)', '2 pcs (25 g red chilies (julienned))', '25 g fried shallot']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "rice vermicelli", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "prawn stock", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "egg", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "prawn", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "chicken", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cabbage", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "choy sum", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "carrot", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "red chilies", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "fried shallot", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Directions for Cooking Fried Mee Hoon:
Soak rice vermicelli for 5 minutes with plain water, drained and set aside for later use.
prawn stock
*For prawn stock: Add 150 g of water to prawn shell, bring to the boil, cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Sieve the prawn stock. Add 4 tbsps of prawn stock, salt and dark soy sauce, mix well.
fried egg
For egg: Add salt and white pepper to egg, beat until combined. Preheat ½ tbsps of cooking oil in non-stick wok, pour in egg. Turn the egg over when the bottom is cooked, remove when both sides are cooked. Set aside until slightly cooled, then cut into strips.
marinate ingredients
Add white pepper, salt, sugar, cornstarch and sesame oil to prawn and chicken strips, mix well.
Cook ingredients
Preheat 3 tbsps of cooking oil, add in chopped garlic, cook until fragrant. Add in prawn and chicken strips, cook until outer layer is cooked. Add in vegetables, cook until softened.
Add rice vermicelli
Add in seasoned prawn stock and soaked rice vermicelli, cook until liquid fully absorbed.
Mix together rice vermicelli and other ingredients, cook until fragrant.
Add in red chilies and egg
Add in red chilies and shredded egg, mix well. Off the heat.
Garnish with fried shallot
Garnish fried mee hoon with crispy fried shallot before serving to enhance the aroma.

title: Deep-Fried Five-Spice Chicken
ingredients_raw: ['660 g chicken pieces', '¾ tsp fine salt', '½ tsp white pepper', '1 tsp five spice powder', '20 g sugar', '1 egg (size: M)', '3 tbsps plain flour', '¼ tsp Eno fruit salt']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "chicken pieces", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "white pepper", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "five spice powder", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "egg", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "plain flour", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "Eno fruit salt", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Directions:
Dry cleaned chicken pieces with kitchen towels.
Pierce chicken pieces with holes using meat tenderizer (or a fork).
marinate
Add salt, sugar, white pepper, five spice powder and egg to chicken, mix well to coat each piece with marinade. Set aside to marinate for 40 minutes.
add in plain flour
After marinating for 40 minutes, add in plain flour, mix well, rest for 10 minutes.
add Eno fruit salt
Preheat cooking oil in a wok. When the oil is preheated, add Eno fruit salt to the chicken just before frying, mix well.
deep-fry
Add chicken pieces into the hot oil, deep-fry between medium-low to medium heat for 18-20 minutes.
remove from oil
Turn to medium-high heat and deep-fry for about half minute before removing the Deep-Fried Five-Spice Chicken from oil.

title: Stir-Fry Cincalok Pork Belly
ingredients_raw: ['550 g skinless pork belly', '55 g shallot (sliced)', '4 tbsps cooking oil', '20 g chopped garlic', '35 g cincalok', '200 g hot water', '⅛ tsp dark soy sauce', '20 g seedless tamarind paste/assam Jawa + 120 g plain water', '40 g sugar', '3 pcs Bird’s Eye Chili/cili padi']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "skinless pork belly", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "shallot", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "cincalok", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "hot water", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dark soy sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "tamarind paste", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "Bird\u2019s Eye Chili", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Directions:
Cut pork belly
Cut skinless pork belly into small thin slices. (Reminder: Clean the meat with water and dry it up using kitchen towels before cutting.)
fried shallot
Add shallot to 4 tbsps of cooking oil, cook over medium-high heat until fragrant, drained. (Reminder: Just add shallot directly to oil without preheated.)
cook garlic & cincalok
Add garlic and cincalok to cooking oil, cook over medium heat until fragrant.
cook pork
Add in sliced pork belly, cook until the outer layer is cooked. (Reminder: Lower the heat of the stove first before adding in meat to prevent the ingredients in the wok from charring, return to higher heat after adding the meat. Spread the meat in a single layer, let the bottom cook first before turning over.)
Add in hot water and dark soy sauce, bring to the boil.
simmer for 25 mins
Reduce to medium-low heat, put on the lid and simmer for 25 minutes, until the meat is tender. (Reminder: Stir the meat 1-2 times in between cooking. If the liquid has dried up before 25 minutes, add in a bit more water.)
add in tamarind water
After 25 minutes, the meat is tender and the liquid has significantly reduced. Turn to medium-high heat, add in tamarind water, sugar, cili padi and fried shallot. Cook for about 1 minute to allow the flavor to blend together. Off the heat, transfer cincalok pork belly to serving dish.

title: Steamed 3-Colour Sweet Potato Cassava Kuih
ingredients_raw: ['160 g steamed yellow sweet potato', '160 g steamed orange sweet potato', '160 g steamed purple sweet potato', '750 g grated cassava*', '290 g thick coconut milk', '100 g plain water', '¾ tsp fine salt', '285 g fine sugar', '180 g tapioca starch']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "steamed yellow sweet potato", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "steamed orange sweet potato", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "steamed purple sweet potato", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "grated cassava", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "thick coconut milk", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "plain water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "fine salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "fine sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "tapioca starch", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Directions:
Prepare sweet potato
Steam yellow, orange and purple sweet potato over medium heat for 35-40 minutes until very soft, then measure out 160 g for each type of steamed sweet potato.
grated cassava
*For grated cassava: You will need 1.0-1.1 kg of cassava. Make a shallow cut on the skin of cassava, peel off the skin with knife, rinse with water. Cut cassava into half, remove the tough fibre in the centre. Cut cassava into wedges, then finely grate with food processor.
grated cassava batter
Measure out 750 g of grated cassava (no need to drain off the liquid). Combine coconut milk, water, salt, sugar and tapioca starch, mix well. Add to grated cassava gradually, mix until combined, then divide into 3 equal portions, each about 530 g.
yellow layer
For yellow layer: Add steamed yellow sweet potato to 1 portion of cassava mixture, blend until smooth. Pour into lined 8″ square baking pan, swirl the pan to let the batter evenly distributed. Put into steamer, steam over medium heat for 8 minutes.
orange layer
For orange layer: Add steamed orange sweet potato to 1 portion of cassava mixture, blend until smooth. Pour orange layer over yellow layer, steam again over medium heat for 8 minutes.
purple layer
For purple layer: Add steamed purple sweet potato to 1 portion of cassava mixture, blend until smooth. Pour purple layer over orange layer, smooth the surface with spatula, steam again over medium heat for 50 minutes, until thoroughly cooked.
cool completely
Set aside to cool completely.
cut into pieces
Unmould Steamed 3-Colour Sweet Potato Cassava Kuih when completely cooled, cut into pieces using plastic knife.

title: Tomato Sweet Sour Fish
ingredients_raw: ['500 g fish (cleaned, I use Golden Pomfret)', '½ tsp fine salt', '1 tbsp cornstarch (for coating)', '2 tbsps cooking oil', '15 g garlic (chopped)', '85 g onion (roughly chopped)', '110 g tomato sauce', '90 g plain water', '1 tsp sugar', '¼ tsp fine salt', '1 pc (100 g tomato (cut into wedges))', '½ pc (15 g red chili (sliced))', '1 stalk (20 g scallion (cut into 2″ length))']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "fish", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "onion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "tomato sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "water", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "tomato", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "red chili", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "scallion", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Directions:
marinate
Dry cleaned fish with kitchen towels. Make a cut on each side of the fish. Then, coat the fish with salt and set aside to marinate for 15 minutes. Coat the fish with cornstarch before deep-frying.
deep-fry
Preheat about 350-400 g of cooking oil to about 180°C/356°F in a non-stick wok, deep-fry fish between medium-low to medium heat for 17-18 minutes (turn the fish for a few times for an even frying), until golden brown. Turn to medium-high heat before removing deep-fried fish from oil. Put the fish on strainer ladle to drain off the oil.
sauté garlic & onion
Preheat 2 tbsps of cooking oil, add in chopped garlic, cook until fragrant. Add in onion, cook until soften.
Add in tomato sauce, let it sizzles for about 20 seconds. Combine 90 g of plain water with 1 tsp of sugar and ¼ tsp fine salt, add into the wok, bring to the boil.
Add in other ingredients
Add in tomato, red chili and scallion, bring to the boil, cook until tomato is softened. Transfer cooked sauce to a bowl.
Serve
Pour the tomato sauce over the perfectly fried fish just before serving.

title: Ginger Shallot Soy Sauce Fish
ingredients_raw: ['500 g Golden Pomfret fish (cleaned)', '½ tsp fine salt', '1 tbsp cornstarch (for coating)', '2 ½ tbsps cooking oil', '30 g shallot (sliced)', '20 g ginger (julienned)', '15 g garlic (chopped)', '2 tbsps light soy sauce', '135 g 9 tbsps plain water', '2 tsps sugar', '1 pc (80 g tomato (cut into wedges))', '½ pc (15 g red chili (sliced))', '1 stalk (15 g scallion (cut into 2″ length))', '1 tsp potato starch']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "Golden Pomfret fish", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "salt", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cornstarch", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "cooking oil", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "shallot", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "ginger", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "light soy sauce", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "plain water", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": false}, {"ingredient": "tomato", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "red chili", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "scallion", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "potato starch", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Directions:
Prepare fish
Dry cleaned fish with kitchen towels. Make a cut on each side of the fish. Then, coat the fish with salt and set aside to marinate for 15 minutes. Coat the fish with cornstarch before deep-frying.
Fry fish
Preheat about 350-400 g of cooking oil to about 180°C/356°F in a non-stick wok, deep-fry fish between medium-low to medium heat for 17-18 minutes (turn the fish for a few times for an even frying), until golden brown. Turn to medium-high heat before removing deep-fried fish from oil. Put the fish on strainer ladle to drain off the oil.
Sauté
Preheat 2 ½ tbsps of cooking oil, add in sliced shallot and julienned ginger, cook until fragrant and lightly browned. Add in chopped garlic, cook until fragrant.
Add light soy sauce
Add in 2 tbsps of light soy sauce, let it sizzle in the hot wok.
Add water
Combine 135 g of plain water and 2 tsps of sugar, add about ⅔ portion into the wok, bring to the boil.
Add other ingredients
Add in tomato, chili and scallion, bring to the boil, cook until tomato is softened.
Add slaked starch
Add 1 tsp of potato starch to the remaining ⅓ portion of water, mix well. Add slaked potato starch to the sauce, cook until thickened. Transfer cooked sauce to a bowl.
Serve
Pour the sauce over the perfectly fried fish just before serving.

title: Stir-Fry Red Bean Curd Pork Belly (Stir-Fry Nam Yue Pork Belly)
ingredients_raw: ['500 g skinless pork belly', '40 g red bean curd (nam yue)', '2 ½ tbsps cooking oil', '30 g shallot (sliced)', '1 tsp dark soy sauce', '5 tsps sugar', '135 g hot water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "skinless pork belly", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "red bean curd (nam yue)", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "shallot (sliced)", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "dark soy sauce", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "sugar", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "hot water", "heat_processed": true}]
instructions:
Directions:
slice pork
Cut skinless pork belly into small thin slices.
Mash red bean curd (nam yue) cube with spoon.
Cook condiment till fragrant
Preheat cooking oil over medium heat in non-stick wok, add in shallot, cook until fragrant. Add in red bean curd, cook until fragrant.
cook pork until outer is cooked
Add in sliced pork belly, cook until the outer layer is cooked. (Reminder: Spread the meat in a single layer, let the bottom cook first before turning over.)
Add in seasoning
Add in dark soy sauce and sugar, mix well.
simmer for 20 mins
Add in hot water, bring to the boil, reduce to medium-low heat, put on the lid and simmer for 20 minutes, until the meat is tender.
cook until sauce dries up
After 20 minutes, the meat is tender. Turn to medium-high heat, cook until the sauce has dried up, oil is split and the meat is shiny. Transfer the Stir-Fry Red Bean Curd Pork Belly to a dish, discard the excess oil in the wok.

title: Simple Home-Cooked Dish: Stir-Fry Dark Soy Sauce Pork Belly
ingredients_raw: ['500 g skinless pork belly', '2 ½ tbsps sugar', '¾ tsp fine salt', '1 tsp ground white pepper', '1 tbsp oyster sauce', '1 tbsp dark soy sauce', '2 tbsps cooking oil', '20 g garlic (chopped)', '120 g hot water']
ingredients_processed: [{"ingredient": "skinless pork belly", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "garlic", "heat_processed": true}, {"ingredient": "hot water", "heat_processed": false}]
instructions:
Directions:
Cut into thin slices
Cut skinless pork belly into small thin slices.
marinate for 15-20 min
Add sugar, salt, white pepper, oyster sauce and dark soy sauce to pork belly, mix well. Set aside to marinate for 15-20 minutes.
cook garlic until fragrant
Preheat cooking oil over medium heat in non-stick wok, then add in chopped garlic, cook until it is fragrant.
cook until outer layer is cooked
Put in marinated pork, cook until the outer layer is cooked.
simmer for 20 mins
Add in hot water, bring to the boil, reduce to medium-low heat, put on the lid and simmer for 20 minutes, until the meat is tender.
cook until sauce has dried up
After 20 minutes, turn to medium-high heat, cook until the sauce has dried up and oil is split, and the meat is shinny. Transfer the Stir-Fry Dark Soy Sauce Pork Belly to a dish, discard excess oil.
